119  it is not already defined. It is used both to determine if a
120  special character is disabled and to disable certain special
121  characters. Posix systems should set to 0, USG systems to -1. */
122 #if !defined (NEW_TTY_DRIVER) && !defined (_POSIX_VDISABLE)

130 /* Define some macros for dealing with assorted signalling disciplines.
131 
132  These macros provide a way to use signal blocking and disabling
133  without smothering your code in a pile of #ifdef's.
134 
135  SIGNALS_UNBLOCK; Stop blocking all signals.
136 
137  {
138  SIGNALS_DECLARE_SAVED (name); Declare a variable to save the
139  signal blocking state.
140  ...
141  SIGNALS_BLOCK (SIGSTOP, name); Block a signal, and save the previous
142  state for restoration later.
143  ...
144  SIGNALS_RESTORE (name); Restore previous signals.
145  }
146 
147 */
148 
149 #ifdef HAVE_POSIX_SIGNALS
150  /* POSIX signals */
151 
152 #define SIGNALS_UNBLOCK \
153  do { sigset_t set; \
154  sigemptyset (&set); \
155  sigprocmask (SIG_SETMASK, &set, (sigset_t *)NULL); \
156  } while (0)
157 
158 #define SIGNALS_DECLARE_SAVED(name) sigset_t name
159 
160 #define SIGNALS_BLOCK(SIG, saved) \
161  do { sigset_t set; \
162  sigemptyset (&set); \
163  sigaddset (&set, SIG); \
164  sigprocmask (SIG_BLOCK, &set, &saved); \
165  } while (0)
166 
167 #define SIGNALS_RESTORE(saved) \
168  sigprocmask (SIG_SETMASK, &saved, (sigset_t *)NULL)
169 
170 
171 #else /* HAVE_POSIX_SIGNALS */
172 #ifdef HAVE_BSD_SIGNALS
173  /* BSD signals */
174 
175 #define SIGNALS_UNBLOCK sigsetmask (0)
176 #define SIGNALS_DECLARE_SAVED(name) int name
177 #define SIGNALS_BLOCK(SIG, saved) saved = sigblock (sigmask (SIG))
178 #define SIGNALS_RESTORE(saved) sigsetmask (saved)
179 
180 
181 #else /* HAVE_BSD_SIGNALS */
182  /* None of the Above */
183 
184 #define SIGNALS_UNBLOCK /* nothing */
185 #define SIGNALS_DECLARE_SAVED(name) /* nothing */
186 #define SIGNALS_BLOCK(SIG, saved) /* nothing */
187 #define SIGNALS_RESTORE(saved) /* nothing */
188 
189 
190 #endif /* HAVE_BSD_SIGNALS */
191 #endif /* HAVE_POSIX_SIGNALS */
192 
193 /* End of signal handling definitions. */
194

404 static void rl_prep_terminal (), rl_deprep_terminal ();

407 /* Read a line of input. Prompt with PROMPT. A NULL PROMPT means
408  none. A return value of NULL means that EOF was encountered. */
409 char *
410 readline (prompt)
411  char *prompt;
412 {
413  char *readline_internal ();
414  char *value;
415 
416  rl_prompt = prompt;
417 
418  /* If we are at EOF return a NULL string. */
419  if (rl_pending_input == EOF)
420  {
421  rl_pending_input = 0;
422  return ((char *)NULL);
423  }
424 
425  rl_initialize ();
426  rl_prep_terminal ();
427 
428 #if defined (HANDLE_SIGNALS)
429  rl_set_signals ();
430 #endif
431 
432  value = readline_internal ();
433  rl_deprep_terminal ();
434 
435 #if defined (HANDLE_SIGNALS)
436  rl_clear_signals ();
437 #endif
438 
439  return (value);
440 }
441 
442 /* Read a line of input from the global rl_instream, doing output on
443  the global rl_outstream.
444  If rl_prompt is non-null, then that is our prompt. */
445 char *
446 readline_internal ()
447 {
448  int lastc, c, eof_found;
449 
450  in_stream = rl_instream;
451  out_stream = rl_outstream;
452 
453  lastc = -1;
454  eof_found = 0;
455 
456  if (rl_startup_hook)
457  (*rl_startup_hook) ();
458 
459  if (!readline_echoing_p)
460  {
461  if (rl_prompt)
462  {
463  fprintf (out_stream, "%s", rl_prompt);
464  fflush (out_stream);
465  }
466  }
467  else
468  {
469  rl_on_new_line ();
470  rl_redisplay ();
471 #if defined (VI_MODE)
472  if (rl_editing_mode == vi_mode)
473  rl_vi_insertion_mode ();
474 #endif /* VI_MODE */
475  }
476 
477  while (!rl_done)
478  {
479  int lk = last_command_was_kill;
480  int code = setjmp (readline_top_level);
481 
482  if (code)
483  rl_redisplay ();
484 
485  if (!rl_pending_input)
486  {
487  /* Then initialize the argument and number of keys read. */
488  rl_init_argument ();
489  rl_key_sequence_length = 0;
490  }
491 
492  c = rl_read_key ();
493 #ifdef WIN32
494  if (!winio_exists()) {
495  eof_found = 1;
496  break;
497  }
498 #endif
499  /* EOF typed to a non-blank line is a <NL>. */
500  if (c == EOF && rl_end)
501  c = NEWLINE;
502 
503  /* The character eof_char typed to blank line, and not as the
504  previous character is interpreted as EOF. */
505  if (((c == eof_char && lastc != c) || c == EOF) && !rl_end)
506  {
507  eof_found = 1;
508  break;
509  }
510 
511  lastc = c;
512  rl_dispatch (c, keymap);
513 
514  /* If there was no change in last_command_was_kill, then no kill
515  has taken place. Note that if input is pending we are reading
516  a prefix command, so nothing has changed yet. */
517  if (!rl_pending_input)
518  {
519  if (lk == last_command_was_kill)
520  last_command_was_kill = 0;
521  }
522 
523 #if defined (VI_MODE)
524  /* In vi mode, when you exit insert mode, the cursor moves back
525  over the previous character. We explicitly check for that here. */
526  if (rl_editing_mode == vi_mode && keymap == vi_movement_keymap)
527  rl_vi_check ();
528 #endif /* VI_MODE */
529 
530  if (!rl_done)
531  rl_redisplay ();
532  }
533 
534  /* Restore the original of this history line, iff the line that we
535  are editing was originally in the history, AND the line has changed. */
536  {
537  HIST_ENTRY *entry = current_history ();
538 
539  if (entry && rl_undo_list)
540  {
541  char *temp = savestring (the_line);
542  rl_revert_line ();
543  entry = replace_history_entry (where_history (), the_line,
544  (HIST_ENTRY *)NULL);
545  free_history_entry (entry);
546 
547  strcpy (the_line, temp);
548  free (temp);
549  }
550  }
551 
552  /* At any rate, it is highly likely that this line has an undo list. Get
553  rid of it now. */
554  if (rl_undo_list)
555  free_undo_list ();
556 
557  if (eof_found)
558  return (char *)NULL;
559  else
560  return (savestring (the_line));
561 }
562

564 /* **************************************************************** */
565 /* */
566 /* Signal Handling */
567 /* */
568 /* **************************************************************** */
569 
570 #if defined (SIGWINCH)
571 static SigHandler *old_sigwinch = (SigHandler *)NULL;
572 
573 static sighandler
574 rl_handle_sigwinch (sig)
575  int sig;
576 {
577  char *term;
578 
579  term = rl_terminal_name;
580 
581  if (readline_echoing_p)
582  {
583  if (!term)
584  term = getenv ("TERM");
585  if (!term)
586  term = "dumb";
587  rl_reset_terminal (term);
588 #if defined (NOTDEF)
589  crlf ();
590  rl_forced_update_display ();
591 #endif /* NOTDEF */
592  }
593 
594  if (old_sigwinch &&
595  old_sigwinch != (SigHandler *)SIG_IGN &&
596  old_sigwinch != (SigHandler *)SIG_DFL)
597  (*old_sigwinch) (sig);
598 #if !defined (VOID_SIGHANDLER)
599  return (0);
600 #endif /* VOID_SIGHANDLER */
601 }
602 #endif /* SIGWINCH */
603 
604 #if defined (HANDLE_SIGNALS)
605 /* Interrupt handling. */
606 static SigHandler
607  *old_int = (SigHandler *)NULL,
608  *old_tstp = (SigHandler *)NULL,
609  *old_ttou = (SigHandler *)NULL,
610  *old_ttin = (SigHandler *)NULL,
611  *old_cont = (SigHandler *)NULL,
612  *old_alrm = (SigHandler *)NULL;
613 
614 /* Handle an interrupt character. */
615 static sighandler
616 rl_signal_handler (sig)
617  int sig;
618 {
619 #if !defined (HAVE_BSD_SIGNALS)
620  /* Since the signal will not be blocked while we are in the signal
621  handler, ignore it until rl_clear_signals resets the catcher. */
622  if (sig == SIGINT)
623  signal (sig, SIG_IGN);
624 #endif /* !HAVE_BSD_SIGNALS */
625 
626  switch (sig)
627  {
628  case SIGINT:
629  free_undo_list ();
630  rl_clear_message ();
631  rl_init_argument ();
632 
633 #if defined (SIGTSTP)
634  case SIGTSTP:
635  case SIGTTOU:
636  case SIGTTIN:
637 #endif /* SIGTSTP */
638  case SIGALRM:
639  rl_clean_up_for_exit ();
640  rl_deprep_terminal ();
641  rl_clear_signals ();
642  rl_pending_input = 0;
643 
644  kill (getpid (), sig);
645 
646  SIGNALS_UNBLOCK;
647 
648  rl_prep_terminal ();
649  rl_set_signals ();
650  }
651 
652 #if !defined (VOID_SIGHANDLER)
653  return (0);
654 #endif /* !VOID_SIGHANDLER */
655 }
656 
657 rl_set_signals ()
658 {
659  old_int = (SigHandler *)signal (SIGINT, rl_signal_handler);
660  if (old_int == (SigHandler *)SIG_IGN)
661  signal (SIGINT, SIG_IGN);
662 
663  old_alrm = (SigHandler *)signal (SIGALRM, rl_signal_handler);
664  if (old_alrm == (SigHandler *)SIG_IGN)
665  signal (SIGALRM, SIG_IGN);
666 
667 #if defined (SIGTSTP)
668  old_tstp = (SigHandler *)signal (SIGTSTP, rl_signal_handler);
669  if (old_tstp == (SigHandler *)SIG_IGN)
670  signal (SIGTSTP, SIG_IGN);
671 #endif
672 #if defined (SIGTTOU)
673  old_ttou = (SigHandler *)signal (SIGTTOU, rl_signal_handler);
674  old_ttin = (SigHandler *)signal (SIGTTIN, rl_signal_handler);
675 
676  if (old_tstp == (SigHandler *)SIG_IGN)
677  {
678  signal (SIGTTOU, SIG_IGN);
679  signal (SIGTTIN, SIG_IGN);
680  }
681 #endif
682 
683 #if defined (SIGWINCH)
684  old_sigwinch = (SigHandler *)signal (SIGWINCH, rl_handle_sigwinch);
685 #endif
686 }
687 
688 rl_clear_signals ()
689 {
690  signal (SIGINT, old_int);
691  signal (SIGALRM, old_alrm);
692 
693 #if defined (SIGTSTP)
694  signal (SIGTSTP, old_tstp);
695 #endif
696 
697 #if defined (SIGTTOU)
698  signal (SIGTTOU, old_ttou);
699  signal (SIGTTIN, old_ttin);
700 #endif
701 
702 #if defined (SIGWINCH)
703  signal (SIGWINCH, old_sigwinch);
704 #endif
705 }
706 #endif /* HANDLE_SIGNALS */
707

709 /* **************************************************************** */
710 /* */
711 /* Character Input Buffering */
712 /* */
713 /* **************************************************************** */
714 
715 #if defined (USE_XON_XOFF)
716 /* If the terminal was in xoff state when we got to it, then xon_char
717  contains the character that is supposed to start it again. */
718 static int xon_char, xoff_state;
719 #endif /* USE_XON_XOFF */
720 
721 static int pop_index = 0, push_index = 0, ibuffer_len = 511;
722 static unsigned char ibuffer[512];
723 
724 /* Non-null means it is a pointer to a function to run while waiting for
725  character input. */
726 Function *rl_event_hook = (Function *)NULL;
727 
728 #define any_typein (push_index != pop_index)
729 
730 /* Add KEY to the buffer of characters to be read. */
731 rl_stuff_char (key)
732  int key;
733 {
734  if (key == EOF)
735  {
736  key = NEWLINE;
737  rl_pending_input = EOF;
738  }
739  ibuffer[push_index++] = key;
740  if (push_index >= ibuffer_len)
741  push_index = 0;
742 }
743 
744 /* Return the amount of space available in the
745  buffer for stuffing characters. */
746 int
747 ibuffer_space ()
748 {
749  if (pop_index > push_index)
750  return (pop_index - push_index);
751  else
752  return (ibuffer_len - (push_index - pop_index));
753 }
754 
755 /* Get a key from the buffer of characters to be read.
756  Return the key in KEY.
757  Result is KEY if there was a key, or 0 if there wasn't. */
758 int
759 rl_get_char (key)
760  int *key;
761 {
762  if (push_index == pop_index)
763  return (0);
764 
765  *key = ibuffer[pop_index++];
766 
767  if (pop_index >= ibuffer_len)
768  pop_index = 0;
769 
770  return (1);
771 }
772 
773 /* Stuff KEY into the *front* of the input buffer.
774  Returns non-zero if successful, zero if there is
775  no space left in the buffer. */
776 int
777 rl_unget_char (key)
778  int key;
779 {
780  if (ibuffer_space ())
781  {
782  pop_index--;
783  if (pop_index < 0)
784  pop_index = ibuffer_len - 1;
785  ibuffer[pop_index] = key;
786  return (1);
787  }
788  return (0);
789 }
790 
791 /* If a character is available to be read, then read it
792  and stuff it into IBUFFER. Otherwise, just return. */
793 rl_gather_tyi ()
794 {
795 #ifdef WIN32
796  while (kbhit() && ibuffer_space()) {
797  rl_stuff_char(winio_getc());
798  }
799 #else
800 #if defined(__GO32__)
801  char input;
802  if (isatty(0))
803  {
804  int i = rl_getc();
805  if (i != EOF)
806  rl_stuff_char(i);
807  }
808  else
809  if (kbhit() && ibuffer_space())
810  rl_stuff_char(getkey());
811 #else
812  int tty = fileno (in_stream);
813  register int tem, result = -1;
814  long chars_avail;
815  char input;
816 
817 #if defined (FIONREAD)
818  result = ioctl (tty, FIONREAD, &chars_avail);
819 #endif
820 
821  if (result == -1)
822  {
823  int flags;
824 
825  flags = fcntl (tty, F_GETFL, 0);
826 
827  fcntl (tty, F_SETFL, (flags | O_NDELAY));
828  chars_avail = read (tty, &input, 1);
829 
830  fcntl (tty, F_SETFL, flags);
831  if (chars_avail == -1 && errno == EAGAIN)
832  return;
833  }
834 
835  /* If there's nothing available, don't waste time trying to read
836  something. */
837  if (chars_avail == 0)
838  return;
839 
840  tem = ibuffer_space ();
841 
842  if (chars_avail > tem)
843  chars_avail = tem;
844 
845  /* One cannot read all of the available input. I can only read a single
846  character at a time, or else programs which require input can be
847  thwarted. If the buffer is larger than one character, I lose.
848  Damn! */
849  if (tem < ibuffer_len)
850  chars_avail = 0;
851 
852  if (result != -1)
853  {
854  while (chars_avail--)
855  rl_stuff_char (rl_getc (in_stream));
856  }
857  else
858  {
859  if (chars_avail)
860  rl_stuff_char (input);
861  }
862 #endif /* def __GO32__/else */
863 #endif
864 }
865 
866 static int next_macro_key ();
867 /* Read a key, including pending input. */
868 int
869 rl_read_key ()
870 {
871  int c;
872 
873  rl_key_sequence_length++;
874 
875  if (rl_pending_input)
876  {
877  c = rl_pending_input;
878  rl_pending_input = 0;
879  }
880  else
881  {
882  /* If input is coming from a macro, then use that. */
883  if (c = next_macro_key ())
884  return (c);
885 
886  /* If the user has an event function, then call it periodically. */
887  if (rl_event_hook)
888  {
889  while (rl_event_hook && !rl_get_char (&c))
890  {
891  (*rl_event_hook) ();
892  if (!winio_rdln_ok()) {
893  printf("%s", rl_prompt);
894  printf("%s", the_line);
895  }
896  rl_gather_tyi ();
897  }
898  }
899  else
900  {
901  if (!rl_get_char (&c))
902  c = rl_getc (in_stream);
903  }
904  }
905 
906  return (c);
907 }
908 
909 /* I'm beginning to hate the declaration rules for various compilers. */
910 static void add_macro_char (), with_macro_input ();
911 
912 /* Do the command associated with KEY in MAP.
913  If the associated command is really a keymap, then read
914  another key, and dispatch into that map. */
915 rl_dispatch (key, map)
916  register int key;
917  Keymap map;
918 {
919 
920  if (defining_kbd_macro)
921  add_macro_char (key);
922 
923  if (key > 127 && key < 256)
924  {
925  if (map[ESC].type == ISKMAP)
926  {
927  map = (Keymap)map[ESC].function;
928  key -= 128;
929  rl_dispatch (key, map);
930  }
931  else
932  ding ();
933  return;
934  }
935 
936  switch (map[key].type)
937  {
938  case ISFUNC:
939  {
940  Function *func = map[key].function;
941 
942  if (func != (Function *)NULL)
943  {
944  /* Special case rl_do_lowercase_version (). */
945  if (func == rl_do_lowercase_version)
946  {
947  rl_dispatch (to_lower (key), map);
948  return;
949  }
950 
951  (*map[key].function)(rl_numeric_arg * rl_arg_sign, key);
952 
953  /* If we have input pending, then the last command was a prefix
954  command. Don't change the state of rl_last_func. Otherwise,
955  remember the last command executed in this variable. */
956  if (!rl_pending_input)
957  rl_last_func = map[key].function;
958  }
959  else
960  {
961  rl_abort ();
962  return;
963  }
964  }
965  break;
966 
967  case ISKMAP:
968  if (map[key].function != (Function *)NULL)
969  {
970  int newkey;
971 
972  rl_key_sequence_length++;
973  newkey = rl_read_key ();
974  rl_dispatch (newkey, (Keymap)map[key].function);
975  }
976  else
977  {
978  rl_abort ();
979  return;
980  }
981  break;
982 
983  case ISMACR:
984  if (map[key].function != (Function *)NULL)
985  {
986  char *macro;
987 
988  macro = savestring ((char *)map[key].function);
989  with_macro_input (macro);
990  return;
991  }
992  break;
993  }
994 }
995 
996 
997 /* **************************************************************** */
998 /* */
999 /* Hacking Keyboard Macros */
1000 /* */
1001 /* **************************************************************** */
1002 
1003 /* The currently executing macro string. If this is non-zero,
1004  then it is a malloc ()'ed string where input is coming from. */
1005 static char *executing_macro = (char *)NULL;
1006 
1007 /* The offset in the above string to the next character to be read. */
1008 static int executing_macro_index = 0;
1009 
1010 /* The current macro string being built. Characters get stuffed
1011  in here by add_macro_char (). */
1012 static char *current_macro = (char *)NULL;
1013 
1014 /* The size of the buffer allocated to current_macro. */
1015 static int current_macro_size = 0;
1016 
1017 /* The index at which characters are being added to current_macro. */
1018 static int current_macro_index = 0;
1019 
1020 /* A structure used to save nested macro strings.
1021  It is a linked list of string/index for each saved macro. */
1022 struct saved_macro {
1023  struct saved_macro *next;
1024  char *string;
1025  int index;
1026 };
1027 
1028 /* The list of saved macros. */
1029 struct saved_macro *macro_list = (struct saved_macro *)NULL;
1030 
1031 /* Forward declarations of static functions. Thank you C. */
1032 static void push_executing_macro (), pop_executing_macro ();
1033 
1034 /* This one has to be declared earlier in the file. */
1035 /* static void add_macro_char (); */
1036 
1037 /* Set up to read subsequent input from STRING.
1038  STRING is free ()'ed when we are done with it. */
1039 static void
1040 with_macro_input (string)
1041  char *string;
1042 {
1043  push_executing_macro ();
1044  executing_macro = string;
1045  executing_macro_index = 0;
1046 }
1047 
1048 /* Return the next character available from a macro, or 0 if
1049  there are no macro characters. */
1050 static int
1051 next_macro_key ()
1052 {
1053  if (!executing_macro)
1054  return (0);
1055 
1056  if (!executing_macro[executing_macro_index])
1057  {
1058  pop_executing_macro ();
1059  return (next_macro_key ());
1060  }
1061 
1062  return (executing_macro[executing_macro_index++]);
1063 }
1064 
1065 /* Save the currently executing macro on a stack of saved macros. */
1066 static void
1067 push_executing_macro ()
1068 {
1069  struct saved_macro *saver;
1070 
1071  saver = (struct saved_macro *)xmalloc (sizeof (struct saved_macro));
1072  saver->next = macro_list;
1073  saver->index = executing_macro_index;
1074  saver->string = executing_macro;
1075 
1076  macro_list = saver;
1077 }
1078 
1079 /* Discard the current macro, replacing it with the one
1080  on the top of the stack of saved macros. */
1081 static void
1082 pop_executing_macro ()
1083 {
1084  if (executing_macro)
1085  free (executing_macro);
1086 
1087  executing_macro = (char *)NULL;
1088  executing_macro_index = 0;
1089 
1090  if (macro_list)
1091  {
1092  struct saved_macro *disposer = macro_list;
1093  executing_macro = macro_list->string;
1094  executing_macro_index = macro_list->index;
1095  macro_list = macro_list->next;
1096  free (disposer);
1097  }
1098 }
1099 
1100 /* Add a character to the macro being built. */
1101 static void
1102 add_macro_char (c)
1103  int c;
1104 {
1105  if (current_macro_index + 1 >= current_macro_size)
1106  {
1107  if (!current_macro)
1108  current_macro = (char *)xmalloc (current_macro_size = 25);
1109  else
1110  current_macro =
1111  (char *)xrealloc (current_macro, current_macro_size += 25);
1112  }
1113 
1114  current_macro[current_macro_index++] = c;
1115  current_macro[current_macro_index] = '\0';
1116 }
1117 
1118 /* Begin defining a keyboard macro.
1119  Keystrokes are recorded as they are executed.
1120  End the definition with rl_end_kbd_macro ().
1121  If a numeric argument was explicitly typed, then append this
1122  definition to the end of the existing macro, and start by
1123  re-executing the existing macro. */
1124 rl_start_kbd_macro (ignore1, ignore2)
1125  int ignore1, ignore2;
1126 {
1127  if (defining_kbd_macro)
1128  rl_abort ();
1129 
1130  if (rl_explicit_arg)
1131  {
1132  if (current_macro)
1133  with_macro_input (savestring (current_macro));
1134  }
1135  else
1136  current_macro_index = 0;
1137 
1138  defining_kbd_macro = 1;
1139 }
1140 
1141 /* Stop defining a keyboard macro.
1142  A numeric argument says to execute the macro right now,
1143  that many times, counting the definition as the first time. */
1144 rl_end_kbd_macro (count, ignore)
1145  int count, ignore;
1146 {
1147  if (!defining_kbd_macro)
1148  rl_abort ();
1149 
1150  current_macro_index -= (rl_key_sequence_length - 1);
1151  current_macro[current_macro_index] = '\0';
1152 
1153  defining_kbd_macro = 0;
1154 
1155  rl_call_last_kbd_macro (--count, 0);
1156 }
1157 
1158 /* Execute the most recently defined keyboard macro.
1159  COUNT says how many times to execute it. */
1160 rl_call_last_kbd_macro (count, ignore)
1161  int count, ignore;
1162 {
1163  if (!current_macro)
1164  rl_abort ();
1165 
1166  while (count--)
1167  with_macro_input (savestring (current_macro));
1168 }
1169

1172 /* */
1173 /* Initializations */
1174 /* */
1175 /* **************************************************************** */
1176 
1177 /* Initliaze readline (and terminal if not already). */
1178 rl_initialize ()
1179 {
1180  extern char *rl_display_prompt;
1181 
1182  /* If we have never been called before, initialize the
1183  terminal and data structures. */
1184  if (!rl_initialized)
1185  {
1186  readline_initialize_everything ();
1187  rl_initialized++;
1188  }
1189 
1190  /* Initalize the current line information. */
1191  rl_point = rl_end = 0;
1192  the_line = rl_line_buffer;
1193  the_line[0] = 0;
1194 
1195  /* We aren't done yet. We haven't even gotten started yet! */
1196  rl_done = 0;
1197 
1198  /* Tell the history routines what is going on. */
1199  start_using_history ();
1200 
1201  /* Make the display buffer match the state of the line. */
1202  {
1203  extern char *rl_display_prompt;
1204  extern int forced_display;
1205 
1206  rl_on_new_line ();
1207 
1208  rl_display_prompt = rl_prompt ? rl_prompt : "";
1209  forced_display = 1;
1210  }
1211 
1212  /* No such function typed yet. */
1213  rl_last_func = (Function *)NULL;
1214 
1215  /* Parsing of key-bindings begins in an enabled state. */
1216  parsing_conditionalized_out = 0;
1217 }
1218 
1219 /* Initialize the entire state of the world. */
1220 readline_initialize_everything ()
1221 {
1222  /* Find out if we are running in Emacs. */
1223  running_in_emacs = getenv ("EMACS");
1224 
1225  /* Set up input and output if they aren't already. */
1226  if (!rl_instream)
1227  rl_instream = stdin;
1228  if (!rl_outstream)
1229  rl_outstream = stdout;
1230 
1231  /* Allocate data structures. */
1232  if (!rl_line_buffer)
1233  rl_line_buffer =
1234  (char *)xmalloc (rl_line_buffer_len = DEFAULT_BUFFER_SIZE);
1235 
1236  /* Initialize the terminal interface. */
1237  init_terminal_io ((char *)NULL);
1238 
1239  /* Bind tty characters to readline functions. */
1240  readline_default_bindings ();
1241 
1242  /* Initialize the function names. */
1243  rl_initialize_funmap ();
1244 
1245  /* Read in the init file. */
1246  rl_read_init_file ((char *)NULL);
1247 
1248  /* If the completion parser's default word break characters haven't
1249  been set yet, then do so now. */
1250  {
1251  extern char *rl_completer_word_break_characters;
1252  extern char *rl_basic_word_break_characters;
1253 
1254  if (rl_completer_word_break_characters == (char *)NULL)
1255  rl_completer_word_break_characters = rl_basic_word_break_characters;
1256  }
1257 }
1258 
1259 /* If this system allows us to look at the values of the regular
1260  input editing characters, then bind them to their readline
1261  equivalents, iff the characters are not bound to keymaps. */
1262 readline_default_bindings ()
1263 {
1264 #if !defined(__GO32__) && !defined(WIN32)
1265 
1266 #if defined (NEW_TTY_DRIVER)
1267  struct sgttyb ttybuff;
1268  int tty = fileno (rl_instream);
1269 
1270  if (ioctl (tty, TIOCGETP, &ttybuff) != -1)
1271  {
1272  int erase, kill;
1273 
1274  erase = ttybuff.sg_erase;
1275  kill = ttybuff.sg_kill;
1276 
1277  if (erase != -1 && keymap[erase].type == ISFUNC)
1278  keymap[erase].function = rl_rubout;
1279 
1280  if (kill != -1 && keymap[kill].type == ISFUNC)
1281  keymap[kill].function = rl_unix_line_discard;
1282  }
1283 
1284 #if defined (TIOCGLTC)
1285  {
1286  struct ltchars lt;
1287 
1288  if (ioctl (tty, TIOCGLTC, &lt) != -1)
1289  {
1290  int erase, nextc;
1291 
1292  erase = lt.t_werasc;
1293  nextc = lt.t_lnextc;
1294 
1295  if (erase != -1 && keymap[erase].type == ISFUNC)
1296  keymap[erase].function = rl_unix_word_rubout;
1297 
1298  if (nextc != -1 && keymap[nextc].type == ISFUNC)
1299  keymap[nextc].function = rl_quoted_insert;
1300  }
1301  }
1302 #endif /* TIOCGLTC */
1303 #else /* not NEW_TTY_DRIVER */
1304 
1305 #if defined (TERMIOS_TTY_DRIVER)
1306  struct termios ttybuff;
1307 #else
1308  struct termio ttybuff;
1309 #endif /* TERMIOS_TTY_DRIVER */
1310  int tty = fileno (rl_instream);
1311 
1312 #if defined (TERMIOS_TTY_DRIVER)
1313  if (tcgetattr (tty, &ttybuff) != -1)
1314 #else
1315  if (ioctl (tty, TCGETA, &ttybuff) != -1)
1316 #endif /* !TERMIOS_TTY_DRIVER */
1317  {
1318  int erase, kill;
1319 
1320  erase = ttybuff.c_cc[VERASE];
1321  kill = ttybuff.c_cc[VKILL];
1322 
1323  if (erase != _POSIX_VDISABLE &&
1324  keymap[(unsigned char)erase].type == ISFUNC)
1325  keymap[(unsigned char)erase].function = rl_rubout;
1326 
1327  if (kill != _POSIX_VDISABLE &&
1328  keymap[(unsigned char)kill].type == ISFUNC)
1329  keymap[(unsigned char)kill].function = rl_unix_line_discard;
1330 
1331 #if defined (VLNEXT) && defined (TERMIOS_TTY_DRIVER)
1332  {
1333  int nextc;
1334 
1335  nextc = ttybuff.c_cc[VLNEXT];
1336 
1337  if (nextc != _POSIX_VDISABLE &&
1338  keymap[(unsigned char)nextc].type == ISFUNC)
1339  keymap[(unsigned char)nextc].function = rl_quoted_insert;
1340  }
1341 #endif /* VLNEXT && TERMIOS_TTY_DRIVER */
1342 
1343 #if defined (VWERASE)
1344  {
1345  int werase;
1346 
1347  werase = ttybuff.c_cc[VWERASE];
1348 
1349  if (werase != _POSIX_VDISABLE &&
1350  keymap[(unsigned char)werase].type == ISFUNC)
1351  keymap[(unsigned char)werase].function = rl_unix_word_rubout;
1352  }
1353 #endif /* VWERASE */
1354  }
1355 #endif /* !NEW_TTY_DRIVER */
1356 #endif /* def __GO32__ */
1357 }

1360 /* **************************************************************** */
1361 /* */
1362 /* Numeric Arguments */
1363 /* */
1364 /* **************************************************************** */
1365 
1366 /* Handle C-u style numeric args, as well as M--, and M-digits. */
1367 
1368 /* Add the current digit to the argument in progress. */
1369 rl_digit_argument (ignore, key)
1370  int ignore, key;
1371 {
1372  rl_pending_input = key;
1373  rl_digit_loop ();
1374 }
1375 
1376 /* What to do when you abort reading an argument. */
1377 rl_discard_argument ()
1378 {
1379  ding ();
1380  rl_clear_message ();
1381  rl_init_argument ();
1382 }
1383 
1384 /* Create a default argument. */
1385 rl_init_argument ()
1386 {
1387  rl_numeric_arg = rl_arg_sign = 1;
1388  rl_explicit_arg = 0;
1389 }
1390 
1391 /* C-u, universal argument. Multiply the current argument by 4.
1392  Read a key. If the key has nothing to do with arguments, then
1393  dispatch on it. If the key is the abort character then abort. */
1394 rl_universal_argument ()
1395 {
1396  rl_numeric_arg *= 4;
1397  rl_digit_loop ();
1398 }
1399 
1400 rl_digit_loop ()
1401 {
1402  int key, c;
1403  while (1)
1404  {
1405  rl_message ("(arg: %d) ", rl_arg_sign * rl_numeric_arg, 0);
1406  key = c = rl_read_key ();
1407 
1408  if (keymap[c].type == ISFUNC &&
1409  keymap[c].function == rl_universal_argument)
1410  {
1411  rl_numeric_arg *= 4;
1412  continue;
1413  }
1414  c = UNMETA (c);
1415  if (numeric (c))
1416  {
1417  if (rl_explicit_arg)
1418  rl_numeric_arg = (rl_numeric_arg * 10) + (c - '0');
1419  else
1420  rl_numeric_arg = (c - '0');
1421  rl_explicit_arg = 1;
1422  }
1423  else
1424  {
1425  if (c == '-' && !rl_explicit_arg)
1426  {
1427  rl_numeric_arg = 1;
1428  rl_arg_sign = -1;
1429  }
1430  else
1431  {
1432  rl_clear_message ();
1433  rl_dispatch (key, keymap);
1434  return;
1435  }
1436  }
1437  }
1438 }

1441 /* **************************************************************** */
1442 /* */
1443 /* Display stuff */
1444 /* */
1445 /* **************************************************************** */
1446 
1447 /* This is the stuff that is hard for me. I never seem to write good
1448  display routines in C. Let's see how I do this time. */
1449 
1450 /* (PWP) Well... Good for a simple line updater, but totally ignores
1451  the problems of input lines longer than the screen width.
1452 
1453  update_line and the code that calls it makes a multiple line,
1454  automatically wrapping line update. Carefull attention needs
1455  to be paid to the vertical position variables.
1456 
1457  handling of terminals with autowrap on (incl. DEC braindamage)
1458  could be improved a bit. Right now I just cheat and decrement
1459  screenwidth by one. */
1460 
1461 /* Keep two buffers; one which reflects the current contents of the
1462  screen, and the other to draw what we think the new contents should
1463  be. Then compare the buffers, and make whatever changes to the
1464  screen itself that we should. Finally, make the buffer that we
1465  just drew into be the one which reflects the current contents of the
1466  screen, and place the cursor where it belongs.
1467 
1468  Commands that want to can fix the display themselves, and then let
1469  this function know that the display has been fixed by setting the
1470  RL_DISPLAY_FIXED variable. This is good for efficiency. */
1471 
1472 /* Termcap variables: */
1473 extern char *term_up, *term_dc, *term_cr;
1474 extern int screenheight, screenwidth, terminal_can_insert;
1475 
1476 /* What YOU turn on when you have handled all redisplay yourself. */
1477 int rl_display_fixed = 0;
1478 
1479 /* The visible cursor position. If you print some text, adjust this. */
1480 int last_c_pos = 0;
1481 int last_v_pos = 0;
1482 
1483 /* The last left edge of text that was displayed. This is used when
1484  doing horizontal scrolling. It shifts in thirds of a screenwidth. */
1485 static int last_lmargin = 0;
1486 
1487 /* The line display buffers. One is the line currently displayed on
1488  the screen. The other is the line about to be displayed. */
1489 static char *visible_line = (char *)NULL;
1490 static char *invisible_line = (char *)NULL;
1491 
1492 /* Number of lines currently on screen minus 1. */
1493 int vis_botlin = 0;
1494 
1495 /* A buffer for `modeline' messages. */
1496 char msg_buf[128];
1497 
1498 /* Non-zero forces the redisplay even if we thought it was unnecessary. */
1499 int forced_display = 0;
1500 
1501 /* The stuff that gets printed out before the actual text of the line.
1502  This is usually pointing to rl_prompt. */
1503 char *rl_display_prompt = (char *)NULL;
1504 
1505 /* Default and initial buffer size. Can grow. */
1506 static int line_size = 1024;
1507 
1508 /* Non-zero means to always use horizontal scrolling in line display. */
1509 static int horizontal_scroll_mode = 0;
1510 
1511 /* Non-zero means to display an asterisk at the starts of history lines
1512  which have been modified. */
1513 static int mark_modified_lines = 0;
1514 
1515 /* Non-zero means to use a visible bell if one is available rather than
1516  simply ringing the terminal bell. */
1517 static int prefer_visible_bell = 0;
1518 
1519 /* I really disagree with this, but my boss (among others) insists that we
1520  support compilers that don't work. I don't think we are gaining by doing
1521  so; what is the advantage in producing better code if we can't use it? */
1522 /* The following two declarations belong inside the
1523  function block, not here. */
1524 static void move_cursor_relative ();
1525 static void output_some_chars ();
1526 static void output_character_function ();
1527 static int compare_strings ();
1528 
1529 /* Basic redisplay algorithm. */
1530 rl_redisplay ()
1531 {
1532  register int in, out, c, linenum;
1533  register char *line = invisible_line;
1534  char *prompt_this_line;
1535  int c_pos = 0;
1536  int inv_botlin = 0; /* Number of lines in newly drawn buffer. */
1537 
1538  extern int readline_echoing_p;
1539 
1540  if (!readline_echoing_p)
1541  return;
1542 
1543  if (!rl_display_prompt)
1544  rl_display_prompt = "";
1545 
1546  if (!invisible_line)
1547  {
1548  visible_line = (char *)xmalloc (line_size);
1549  invisible_line = (char *)xmalloc (line_size);
1550  line = invisible_line;
1551  for (in = 0; in < line_size; in++)
1552  {
1553  visible_line[in] = 0;
1554  invisible_line[in] = 1;
1555  }
1556  rl_on_new_line ();
1557  }
1558 
1559  /* Draw the line into the buffer. */
1560  c_pos = -1;
1561 
1562  /* Mark the line as modified or not. We only do this for history
1563  lines. */
1564  out = 0;
1565  if (mark_modified_lines && current_history () && rl_undo_list)
1566  {
1567  line[out++] = '*';
1568  line[out] = '\0';
1569  }
1570 
1571  /* If someone thought that the redisplay was handled, but the currently
1572  visible line has a different modification state than the one about
1573  to become visible, then correct the callers misconception. */
1574  if (visible_line[0] != invisible_line[0])
1575  rl_display_fixed = 0;
1576 
1577  prompt_this_line = rindex (rl_display_prompt, '\n');
1578  if (!prompt_this_line)
1579  prompt_this_line = rl_display_prompt;
1580  else
1581  {
1582  prompt_this_line++;
1583  if (forced_display)
1584  output_some_chars (rl_display_prompt,
1585  prompt_this_line - rl_display_prompt);
1586  }
1587 
1588  strncpy (line + out, prompt_this_line, strlen (prompt_this_line));
1589  out += strlen (prompt_this_line);
1590  line[out] = '\0';
1591 
1592  for (in = 0; in < rl_end; in++)
1593  {
1594  c = (unsigned char)the_line[in];
1595 
1596  if (out + 1 >= line_size)
1597  {
1598  line_size *= 2;
1599  visible_line = (char *)xrealloc (visible_line, line_size);
1600  invisible_line = (char *)xrealloc (invisible_line, line_size);
1601  line = invisible_line;
1602  }
1603 
1604  if (in == rl_point)
1605  c_pos = out;
1606 
1607  if (c > 127)
1608  {
1609  line[out++] = 'M';
1610  line[out++] = '-';
1611  line[out++] = c - 128;
1612  }
1613 #define DISPLAY_TABS
1614 #if defined (DISPLAY_TABS)
1615  else if (c == '\t')
1616  {
1617  register int newout = (out | (int)7) + 1;
1618  while (out < newout)
1619  line[out++] = ' ';
1620  }
1621 #endif
1622  else if (c < 32)
1623  {
1624  line[out++] = 'C';
1625  line[out++] = '-';
1626  line[out++] = c + 64;
1627  }
1628  else if (c == 127)
1629  {
1630  line[out++] = 'C';
1631  line[out++] = '-';
1632  line[out++] = '?';
1633  }
1634  else
1635  line[out++] = c;
1636  }
1637  line[out] = '\0';
1638  if (c_pos < 0)
1639  c_pos = out;
1640 
1641  /* PWP: now is when things get a bit hairy. The visible and invisible
1642  line buffers are really multiple lines, which would wrap every
1643  (screenwidth - 1) characters. Go through each in turn, finding
1644  the changed region and updating it. The line order is top to bottom. */
1645 
1646  /* If we can move the cursor up and down, then use multiple lines,
1647  otherwise, let long lines display in a single terminal line, and
1648  horizontally scroll it. */
1649 
1650  if (!horizontal_scroll_mode && term_up && *term_up)
1651  {
1652  int total_screen_chars = (screenwidth * screenheight);
1653 
1654  if (!rl_display_fixed || forced_display)
1655  {
1656  forced_display = 0;
1657 
1658  /* If we have more than a screenful of material to display, then
1659  only display a screenful. We should display the last screen,
1660  not the first. I'll fix this in a minute. */
1661  if (out >= total_screen_chars)
1662  out = total_screen_chars - 1;
1663 
1664  /* Number of screen lines to display. */
1665  inv_botlin = out / screenwidth;
1666 
1667  /* For each line in the buffer, do the updating display. */
1668  for (linenum = 0; linenum <= inv_botlin; linenum++)
1669  update_line (linenum > vis_botlin ? ""
1670  : &visible_line[linenum * screenwidth],
1671  &invisible_line[linenum * screenwidth],
1672  linenum);
1673 
1674  /* We may have deleted some lines. If so, clear the left over
1675  blank ones at the bottom out. */
1676  if (vis_botlin > inv_botlin)
1677  {
1678  char *tt;
1679  for (; linenum <= vis_botlin; linenum++)
1680  {
1681  tt = &visible_line[linenum * screenwidth];
1682  move_vert (linenum);
1683  move_cursor_relative (0, tt);
1684  clear_to_eol ((linenum == vis_botlin)?
1685  strlen (tt) : screenwidth);
1686  }
1687  }
1688  vis_botlin = inv_botlin;
1689 
1690  /* Move the cursor where it should be. */
1691  move_vert (c_pos / screenwidth);
1692  move_cursor_relative (c_pos % screenwidth,
1693  &invisible_line[(c_pos / screenwidth) * screenwidth]);
1694  }
1695  }
1696  else /* Do horizontal scrolling. */
1697  {
1698  int lmargin;
1699 
1700  /* Always at top line. */
1701  last_v_pos = 0;
1702 
1703  /* If the display position of the cursor would be off the edge
1704  of the screen, start the display of this line at an offset that
1705  leaves the cursor on the screen. */
1706  if (c_pos - last_lmargin > screenwidth - 2)
1707  lmargin = (c_pos / (screenwidth / 3) - 2) * (screenwidth / 3);
1708  else if (c_pos - last_lmargin < 1)
1709  lmargin = ((c_pos - 1) / (screenwidth / 3)) * (screenwidth / 3);
1710  else
1711  lmargin = last_lmargin;
1712 
1713  /* If the first character on the screen isn't the first character
1714  in the display line, indicate this with a special character. */
1715  if (lmargin > 0)
1716  line[lmargin] = '<';
1717 
1718  if (lmargin + screenwidth < out)
1719  line[lmargin + screenwidth - 1] = '>';
1720 
1721  if (!rl_display_fixed || forced_display || lmargin != last_lmargin)
1722  {
1723  forced_display = 0;
1724  update_line (&visible_line[last_lmargin],
1725  &invisible_line[lmargin], 0);
1726 
1727  move_cursor_relative (c_pos - lmargin, &invisible_line[lmargin]);
1728  last_lmargin = lmargin;
1729  }
1730  }
1731  fflush (out_stream);
1732 
1733  /* Swap visible and non-visible lines. */
1734  {
1735  char *temp = visible_line;
1736  visible_line = invisible_line;
1737  invisible_line = temp;
1738  rl_display_fixed = 0;
1739  }
1740 }
1741 
1742 /* PWP: update_line() is based on finding the middle difference of each
1743  line on the screen; vis:
1744 
1745  /old first difference
1746  /beginning of line | /old last same /old EOL
1747  v v v v
1748 old: eddie> Oh, my little gruntle-buggy is to me, as lurgid as
1749 new: eddie> Oh, my little buggy says to me, as lurgid as
1750  ^ ^ ^ ^
1751  \beginning of line | \new last same \new end of line
1752  \new first difference
1753 
1754  All are character pointers for the sake of speed. Special cases for
1755  no differences, as well as for end of line additions must be handeled.
1756 
1757  Could be made even smarter, but this works well enough */
1758 static
1759 update_line (old, new, current_line)
1760  register char *old, *new;
1761  int current_line;
1762 {
1763  register char *ofd, *ols, *oe, *nfd, *nls, *ne;
1764  int lendiff, wsatend;
1765 
1766  /* Find first difference. */
1767  for (ofd = old, nfd = new;
1768  (ofd - old < screenwidth) && *ofd && (*ofd == *nfd);
1769  ofd++, nfd++)
1770  ;
1771 
1772  /* Move to the end of the screen line. */
1773  for (oe = ofd; ((oe - old) < screenwidth) && *oe; oe++);
1774  for (ne = nfd; ((ne - new) < screenwidth) && *ne; ne++);
1775 
1776  /* If no difference, continue to next line. */
1777  if (ofd == oe && nfd == ne)
1778  return;
1779 
1780  wsatend = 1; /* flag for trailing whitespace */
1781  ols = oe - 1; /* find last same */
1782  nls = ne - 1;
1783  while ((ols > ofd) && (nls > nfd) && (*ols == *nls))
1784  {
1785  if (*ols != ' ')
1786  wsatend = 0;
1787  ols--;
1788  nls--;
1789  }
1790 
1791  if (wsatend)
1792  {
1793  ols = oe;
1794  nls = ne;
1795  }
1796  else if (*ols != *nls)
1797  {
1798  if (*ols) /* don't step past the NUL */
1799  ols++;
1800  if (*nls)
1801  nls++;
1802  }
1803 
1804  move_vert (current_line);
1805  move_cursor_relative (ofd - old, old);
1806 
1807  /* if (len (new) > len (old)) */
1808  lendiff = (nls - nfd) - (ols - ofd);
1809 
1810  /* Insert (diff(len(old),len(new)) ch */
1811  if (lendiff > 0)
1812  {
1813  if (terminal_can_insert)
1814  {
1815  extern char *term_IC;
1816 
1817  /* Sometimes it is cheaper to print the characters rather than
1818  use the terminal's capabilities. */
1819  if ((2 * (ne - nfd)) < lendiff && !term_IC)
1820  {
1821  output_some_chars (nfd, (ne - nfd));
1822  last_c_pos += (ne - nfd);
1823  }
1824  else
1825  {
1826  if (*ols)
1827  {
1828  insert_some_chars (nfd, lendiff);
1829  last_c_pos += lendiff;
1830  }
1831  else
1832  {
1833  /* At the end of a line the characters do not have to
1834  be "inserted". They can just be placed on the screen. */
1835  output_some_chars (nfd, lendiff);
1836  last_c_pos += lendiff;
1837  }
1838  /* Copy (new) chars to screen from first diff to last match. */
1839  if (((nls - nfd) - lendiff) > 0)
1840  {
1841  output_some_chars (&nfd[lendiff], ((nls - nfd) - lendiff));
1842  last_c_pos += ((nls - nfd) - lendiff);
1843  }
1844  }
1845  }
1846  else
1847  { /* cannot insert chars, write to EOL */
1848  output_some_chars (nfd, (ne - nfd));
1849  last_c_pos += (ne - nfd);
1850  }
1851  }
1852  else /* Delete characters from line. */
1853  {
1854  /* If possible and inexpensive to use terminal deletion, then do so. */
1855  if (term_dc && (2 * (ne - nfd)) >= (-lendiff))
1856  {
1857  if (lendiff)
1858  delete_chars (-lendiff); /* delete (diff) characters */
1859 
1860  /* Copy (new) chars to screen from first diff to last match */
1861  if ((nls - nfd) > 0)
1862  {
1863  output_some_chars (nfd, (nls - nfd));
1864  last_c_pos += (nls - nfd);
1865  }
1866  }
1867  /* Otherwise, print over the existing material. */
1868  else
1869  {
1870  output_some_chars (nfd, (ne - nfd));
1871  last_c_pos += (ne - nfd);
1872  clear_to_eol ((oe - old) - (ne - new));
1873  }
1874  }
1875 }
1876 
1877 /* (PWP) tell the update routines that we have moved onto a
1878  new (empty) line. */
1879 rl_on_new_line ()
1880 {
1881  if (visible_line)
1882  visible_line[0] = '\0';
1883 
1884  last_c_pos = last_v_pos = 0;
1885  vis_botlin = last_lmargin = 0;
1886 }
1887 
1888 /* Actually update the display, period. */
1889 rl_forced_update_display ()
1890 {
1891  if (visible_line)
1892  {
1893  register char *temp = visible_line;
1894 
1895  while (*temp) *temp++ = '\0';
1896  }
1897  rl_on_new_line ();
1898  forced_display++;
1899  rl_redisplay ();
1900 }
1901 
1902 /* Move the cursor from last_c_pos to NEW, which are buffer indices.
1903  DATA is the contents of the screen line of interest; i.e., where
1904  the movement is being done. */
1905 static void
1906 move_cursor_relative (new, data)
1907  int new;
1908  char *data;
1909 {
1910 #ifdef WIN32
1911  winio_rel_move(new);
1912  last_c_pos = new;
1913  return;
1914 #else
1915  register int i;
1916 
1917 #if GRX
1918  if (egagrph) {
1919  grx_rel_move(new);
1920  last_c_pos = new;
1921  return;
1922  }
1923 #endif
1924 
1925  /* It may be faster to output a CR, and then move forwards instead
1926  of moving backwards. */
1927  if (new + 1 < last_c_pos - new)
1928  {
1929 #ifdef __MSDOS__
1930  putc('\r', out_stream);
1931 #else
1932  tputs (term_cr, 1, output_character_function);
1933 #endif
1934  last_c_pos = 0;
1935  }
1936 
1937  if (last_c_pos == new) return;
1938 
1939  if (last_c_pos < new)
1940  {
1941  /* Move the cursor forward. We do it by printing the command
1942  to move the cursor forward if there is one, else print that
1943  portion of the output buffer again. Which is cheaper? */
1944 
1945  /* The above comment is left here for posterity. It is faster
1946  to print one character (non-control) than to print a control
1947  sequence telling the terminal to move forward one character.
1948  That kind of control is for people who don't know what the
1949  data is underneath the cursor. */
1950 #if defined (HACK_TERMCAP_MOTION)
1951  extern char *term_forward_char;
1952 
1953  if (term_forward_char)
1954  for (i = last_c_pos; i < new; i++)
1955  tputs (term_forward_char, 1, output_character_function);
1956  else
1957  for (i = last_c_pos; i < new; i++)
1958  putc (data[i], out_stream);
1959 #else
1960  for (i = last_c_pos; i < new; i++)
1961  putc (data[i], out_stream);
1962 #endif /* HACK_TERMCAP_MOTION */
1963  }
1964  else
1965  backspace (last_c_pos - new);
1966  last_c_pos = new;
1967 #endif
1968 }
1969 
1970 /* PWP: move the cursor up or down. */
1971 move_vert (to)
1972  int to;
1973 {
1974 #ifdef WIN32
1975 #else
1976  void output_character_function ();
1977  register int delta, i;
1978 
1979  if (last_v_pos == to) return;
1980 
1981  if (to > screenheight)
1982  return;
1983 
1984 #if defined(__GO32__)
1985  {
1986  int cur_r, cur_c;
1987  ScreenGetCursor(&cur_r, &cur_c);
1988  ScreenSetCursor(cur_r+to-last_v_pos, cur_c);
1989  }
1990 #else /* __GO32__ */
1991  if ((delta = to - last_v_pos) > 0)
1992  {
1993  for (i = 0; i < delta; i++)
1994  putc ('\n', out_stream);
1995  tputs (term_cr, 1, output_character_function);
1996  last_c_pos = 0;
1997  }
1998  else
1999  { /* delta < 0 */
2000  if (term_up && *term_up)
2001  for (i = 0; i < -delta; i++)
2002  tputs (term_up, 1, output_character_function);
2003  }
2004 #endif /* __GO32__ */
2005 #endif
2006  last_v_pos = to; /* now to is here */
2007 }
2008 
2009 /* Physically print C on out_stream. This is for functions which know
2010  how to optimize the display. */
2011 rl_show_char (c)
2012  int c;
2013 {
2014  if (c > 127)
2015  {
2016  fprintf (out_stream, "M-");
2017  c -= 128;
2018  }
2019 
2020 #if defined (DISPLAY_TABS)
2021  if (c < 32 && c != '\t')
2022 #else
2023  if (c < 32)
2024 #endif
2025  {
2026 
2027  c += 64;
2028  }
2029 
2030  putc (c, out_stream);
2031  fflush (out_stream);
2032 }
2033 
2034 #if defined (DISPLAY_TABS)
2035 int
2036 rl_character_len (c, pos)
2037  register int c, pos;
2038 {
2039  if (c < ' ' || c > 126)
2040  {
2041  if (c == '\t')
2042  return (((pos | (int)7) + 1) - pos);
2043  else
2044  return (3);
2045  }
2046  else
2047  return (1);
2048 }
2049 #else
2050 int
2051 rl_character_len (c)
2052  int c;
2053 {
2054  if (c < ' ' || c > 126)
2055  return (3);
2056  else
2057  return (1);
2058 }
2059 #endif /* DISPLAY_TAB */

2063 rl_message (string, arg1, arg2)

2066  sprintf (msg_buf, string, arg1, arg2);

2080 /* Terminal and Termcap */

2084 static char *term_buffer = (char *)NULL;
2085 static char *term_string_buffer = (char *)NULL;
2086 
2087 /* Non-zero means this terminal can't really do anything. */
2088 int dumb_term = 0;
2089 
2090 /* On Solaris2, sys/types.h brings in sys/reg.h,
2091  which screws up the Termcap variable PC, used below. */
2092 
2093 #undef PC
2094 
2095 char PC;
2096 char *BC, *UP;
2097 
2098 /* Some strings to control terminal actions. These are output by tputs (). */
2099 char *term_goto, *term_clreol, *term_cr, *term_clrpag, *term_backspace;
2100 
2101 int screenwidth, screenheight;
2102 
2103 /* Non-zero if we determine that the terminal can do character insertion. */
2104 int terminal_can_insert = 0;
2105 
2106 /* How to insert characters. */
2107 char *term_im, *term_ei, *term_ic, *term_ip, *term_IC;
2108 
2109 /* How to delete characters. */
2110 char *term_dc, *term_DC;
2111 
2112 #if defined (HACK_TERMCAP_MOTION)
2113 char *term_forward_char;
2114 #endif /* HACK_TERMCAP_MOTION */
2115 
2116 /* How to go up a line. */
2117 char *term_up;
2118 
2119 /* A visible bell, if the terminal can be made to flash the screen. */
2120 char *visible_bell;
2121 
2122 /* Re-initialize the terminal considering that the TERM/TERMCAP variable
2123  has changed. */
2124 rl_reset_terminal (terminal_name)
2125  char *terminal_name;
2126 {
2127  init_terminal_io (terminal_name);
2128 }
2129 
2130 init_terminal_io (terminal_name)
2131  char *terminal_name;
2132 {
2133 #ifdef WIN32
2134  winio_size(&screenheight, &screenwidth);
2135 #else
2136 #if defined(__GO32__)
2137  screenwidth = ScreenCols();
2138  screenheight = ScreenRows();
2139  term_cr = "\r";
2140  term_im = term_ei = term_ic = term_IC = (char *)NULL;
2141  term_up = term_dc = term_DC = visible_bell = (char *)NULL;
2142 #if defined (HACK_TERMCAP_MOTION)
2143  term_forward_char = (char *)NULL;
2144 #endif
2145  terminal_can_insert = 0;
2146  return;
2147 #else
2148  extern char *tgetstr ();
2149  char *term, *buffer;
2150 #if defined (TIOCGWINSZ) && !defined (TIOCGWINSZ_BROKEN)
2151  struct winsize window_size;
2152 #endif
2153  int tty;
2154 
2155  term = terminal_name ? terminal_name : getenv ("TERM");
2156 
2157  if (!term_string_buffer)
2158  term_string_buffer = (char *)xmalloc (2048);
2159 
2160  if (!term_buffer)
2161  term_buffer = (char *)xmalloc (2048);
2162 
2163  buffer = term_string_buffer;
2164 
2165  term_clrpag = term_cr = term_clreol = (char *)NULL;
2166 
2167  if (!term)
2168  term = "dumb";
2169 
2170  if (tgetent (term_buffer, term) <= 0)
2171  {
2172  dumb_term = 1;
2173  screenwidth = 79;
2174  screenheight = 24;
2175  term_cr = "\r";
2176  term_im = term_ei = term_ic = term_IC = (char *)NULL;
2177  term_up = term_dc = term_DC = visible_bell = (char *)NULL;
2178 #if defined (HACK_TERMCAP_MOTION)
2179  term_forward_char = (char *)NULL;
2180 #endif
2181  terminal_can_insert = 0;
2182  return;
2183  }
2184 
2185  BC = tgetstr ("pc", &buffer);
2186  PC = buffer ? *buffer : 0;
2187 
2188  term_backspace = tgetstr ("le", &buffer);
2189 
2190  term_cr = tgetstr ("cr", &buffer);
2191  term_clreol = tgetstr ("ce", &buffer);
2192  term_clrpag = tgetstr ("cl", &buffer);
2193 
2194  if (!term_cr)
2195  term_cr = "\r";
2196 
2197 #if defined (HACK_TERMCAP_MOTION)
2198  term_forward_char = tgetstr ("nd", &buffer);
2199 #endif /* HACK_TERMCAP_MOTION */
2200 
2201  if (rl_instream)
2202  tty = fileno (rl_instream);
2203  else
2204  tty = 0;
2205 
2206  screenwidth = screenheight = 0;
2207 #if defined (TIOCGWINSZ) && !defined (TIOCGWINSZ_BROKEN)
2208  if (ioctl (tty, TIOCGWINSZ, &window_size) == 0)
2209  {
2210  screenwidth = (int) window_size.ws_col;
2211  screenheight = (int) window_size.ws_row;
2212  }
2213 #endif
2214 
2215  if (screenwidth <= 0 || screenheight <= 0)
2216  {
2217  screenwidth = tgetnum ("co");
2218  screenheight = tgetnum ("li");
2219  }
2220 
2221  screenwidth--;
2222 
2223  if (screenwidth <= 0)
2224  screenwidth = 79;
2225 
2226  if (screenheight <= 0)
2227  screenheight = 24;
2228 
2229  term_im = tgetstr ("im", &buffer);
2230  term_ei = tgetstr ("ei", &buffer);
2231  term_IC = tgetstr ("IC", &buffer);
2232  term_ic = tgetstr ("ic", &buffer);
2233 
2234  /* "An application program can assume that the terminal can do
2235  character insertion if *any one of* the capabilities `IC',
2236  `im', `ic' or `ip' is provided." But we can't do anything if
2237  only `ip' is provided, so... */
2238  terminal_can_insert = (term_IC || term_im || term_ic);
2239 
2240  term_up = tgetstr ("up", &buffer);
2241  term_dc = tgetstr ("dc", &buffer);
2242  term_DC = tgetstr ("DC", &buffer);
2243 
2244  visible_bell = tgetstr ("vb", &buffer);
2245 #endif /* !__GO32__ */
2246 #endif
2247 }

2249 /* A function for the use of tputs () */
2250 static void
2251 output_character_function (c)
2252  int c;
2253 {
2254  putc (c, out_stream);
2255 }
2256 
2257 /* Write COUNT characters from STRING to the output stream. */
2258 static void
2259 output_some_chars (string, count)
2260  char *string;
2261  int count;
2262 {
2263 #ifdef WIN32
2264  winio_output_some_chars(string, count);
2265 #else
2266 #if GRX
2267  if (egagrph) {
2268  grx_output_some_chars(string, count);
2269  }else
2270 #endif
2271  {
2272  fwrite (string, 1, count, out_stream);
2273  }
2274 #endif
2275 }
2276 
2277 /* Delete COUNT characters from the display line. */
2278 static
2279 delete_chars (count)
2280  int count;
2281 {
2282 #ifdef WIN32
2283  winio_delete_chars(count);
2284 #else
2285 #if defined(__GO32__)
2286  int r, c, w;
2287 #if GRX
2288  if (egagrph) {
2289  grx_delete_chars(count);
2290  }else
2291 #endif
2292  {
2293  ScreenGetCursor(&r, &c);
2294  w = ScreenCols();
2295  memcpy(ScreenPrimary+r*w+c, ScreenPrimary+r*w+c+count, w-c-count);
2296  memset(ScreenPrimary+r*w+w-count, 0, count*2);
2297  }
2298 #else /* __GO32__ */
2299  if (count > screenwidth)
2300  return;
2301 
2302  if (term_DC && *term_DC)
2303  {
2304  char *tgoto (), *buffer;
2305  buffer = tgoto (term_DC, 0, count);
2306  tputs (buffer, 1, output_character_function);
2307  }
2308  else
2309  {
2310  if (term_dc && *term_dc)
2311  while (count--)
2312  tputs (term_dc, 1, output_character_function);
2313  }
2314 #endif /* __GO32__ */
2315 #endif
2316 }
2317 
2318 /* Insert COUNT characters from STRING to the output stream. */
2319 static void
2320 insert_some_chars (string, count)
2321  char *string;
2322  int count;
2323 {
2324 #ifdef WIN32
2325  winio_insert_some_chars(string, count);
2326 #else
2327 #if defined(__GO32__)
2328  int r, c, w;
2329 #if GRX
2330  if (egagrph) {
2331  grx_insert_some_chars(string, count);
2332  }else
2333 #endif
2334  {
2335  ScreenGetCursor(&r, &c);
2336  w = ScreenCols();
2337  memcpy(ScreenPrimary+r*w+c+count, ScreenPrimary+r*w+c, w-c-count);
2338  /* Print the text. */
2339  output_some_chars (string, count);
2340  }
2341 #else /* __GO32__ */
2342  /* If IC is defined, then we do not have to "enter" insert mode. */
2343  if (term_IC)
2344  {
2345  char *tgoto (), *buffer;
2346  buffer = tgoto (term_IC, 0, count);
2347  tputs (buffer, 1, output_character_function);
2348  output_some_chars (string, count);
2349  }
2350  else
2351  {
2352  register int i;
2353 
2354  /* If we have to turn on insert-mode, then do so. */
2355  if (term_im && *term_im)
2356  tputs (term_im, 1, output_character_function);
2357 
2358  /* If there is a special command for inserting characters, then
2359  use that first to open up the space. */
2360  if (term_ic && *term_ic)
2361  {
2362  for (i = count; i--; )
2363  tputs (term_ic, 1, output_character_function);
2364  }
2365 
2366  /* Print the text. */
2367  output_some_chars (string, count);
2368 
2369  /* If there is a string to turn off insert mode, we had best use
2370  it now. */
2371  if (term_ei && *term_ei)
2372  tputs (term_ei, 1, output_character_function);
2373  }
2374 #endif /* __GO32__ */
2375 #endif
2376 }
2377 
2378 /* Move the cursor back. */
2379 backspace (count)
2380  int count;
2381 {
2382 #ifdef WIN32
2383  winio_backspace(count);
2384 #else
2385  register int i;
2386 
2387 #ifndef __GO32__
2388  if (term_backspace)
2389  for (i = 0; i < count; i++)
2390  tputs (term_backspace, 1, output_character_function);
2391  else
2392 #endif /* !__GO32__ */
2393 #if GRX
2394  if (egagrph) {
2395  grx_backspace(count);
2396  }else
2397 #endif
2398  {
2399  for (i = 0; i < count; i++)
2400  putc ('\b', out_stream);
2401  }
2402  #endif
2403 }

2405 /* Move to the start of the next line. */
2406 crlf ()
2407 {
2408 #ifdef WIN32
2409  printf("\n");
2410 #else
2411 #if defined (NEW_TTY_DRIVER)
2412  tputs (term_cr, 1, output_character_function);
2413 #endif /* NEW_TTY_DRIVER */
2414 #if GRX
2415  if (egagrph) {
2416  grx_output_some_chars("\n", 1);
2417  }else
2418 #endif
2419  {
2420  putc ('\n', out_stream);
2421  }
2422 #endif
2423 }

2425 /* Clear to the end of the line. COUNT is the minimum
2426  number of character spaces to clear, */
2427 static void
2428 clear_to_eol (count)
2429  int count;
2430 {
2431 #ifdef WIN32
2432  winio_clear_to_eol();
2433 #else
2434 #ifndef __GO32__
2435  if (term_clreol)
2436  {
2437  tputs (term_clreol, 1, output_character_function);
2438  }
2439  else
2440 #endif /* !__GO32__ */

2442  register int i;
2443 
2444  /* Do one more character space. */
2445  count++;
2446 #if GRX
2447  if (egagrph) {
2448  grx_clear_to_eol();
2449  }else
2450 #endif
2451  {
2452  for (i = 0; i < count; i++)
2453  putc (' ', out_stream);
2454 
2455  backspace (count);
2456  }
2457  }
2458 #endif
2459 }

2462 /* **************************************************************** */
2463 /* */
2464 /* Saving and Restoring the TTY */
2465 /* */
2466 /* **************************************************************** */
2467 
2468 /* Non-zero means that the terminal is in a prepped state. */
2469 static int terminal_prepped = 0;
2470 
2471 #if defined (NEW_TTY_DRIVER)
2472 
2473 /* Standard flags, including ECHO. */
2474 static int original_tty_flags = 0;
2475 
2476 /* Local mode flags, like LPASS8. */
2477 static int local_mode_flags = 0;
2478 
2479 /* Terminal characters. This has C-s and C-q in it. */
2480 static struct tchars original_tchars;
2481 
2482 /* Local special characters. This has the interrupt characters in it. */
2483 #if defined (TIOCGLTC)
2484 static struct ltchars original_ltchars;
2485 #endif
2486 
2487 /* We use this to get and set the tty_flags. */
2488 static struct sgttyb the_ttybuff;
2489 
2490 /* Put the terminal in CBREAK mode so that we can detect key presses. */
2491 static void
2492 rl_prep_terminal ()
2493 {
2494 #if !defined(__GO32__) && !defined(WIN32)
2495  int tty = fileno (rl_instream);
2496  SIGNALS_DECLARE_SAVED (saved_signals);
2497 
2498  if (terminal_prepped)
2499  return;
2500 
2501  SIGNALS_BLOCK (SIGINT, saved_signals);
2502 
2503  /* We always get the latest tty values. Maybe stty changed them. */
2504  ioctl (tty, TIOCGETP, &the_ttybuff);
2505  original_tty_flags = the_ttybuff.sg_flags;
2506 
2507  readline_echoing_p = (original_tty_flags & ECHO);
2508 
2509 #if defined (TIOCLGET)
2510  ioctl (tty, TIOCLGET, &local_mode_flags);
2511 #endif
2512 
2513 #if !defined (ANYP)
2514 # define ANYP (EVENP | ODDP)
2515 #endif
2516 
2517  /* If this terminal doesn't care how the 8th bit is used,
2518  then we can use it for the meta-key. We check by seeing
2519  if BOTH odd and even parity are allowed. */
2520  if (the_ttybuff.sg_flags & ANYP)
2521  {
2522 #if defined (PASS8)
2523  the_ttybuff.sg_flags |= PASS8;
2524 #endif
2525 
2526  /* Hack on local mode flags if we can. */
2527 #if defined (TIOCLGET) && defined (LPASS8)
2528  {
2529  int flags;
2530  flags = local_mode_flags | LPASS8;
2531  ioctl (tty, TIOCLSET, &flags);
2532  }
2533 #endif /* TIOCLGET && LPASS8 */
2534  }
2535 
2536 #if defined (TIOCGETC)
2537  {
2538  struct tchars temp;
2539 
2540  ioctl (tty, TIOCGETC, &original_tchars);
2541  temp = original_tchars;
2542 
2543 #if defined (USE_XON_XOFF)
2544  /* Get rid of C-s and C-q.
2545  We remember the value of startc (C-q) so that if the terminal is in
2546  xoff state, the user can xon it by pressing that character. */
2547  xon_char = temp.t_startc;
2548  temp.t_stopc = -1;
2549  temp.t_startc = -1;
2550 
2551  /* If there is an XON character, bind it to restart the output. */
2552  if (xon_char != -1)
2553  rl_bind_key (xon_char, rl_restart_output);
2554 #endif /* USE_XON_XOFF */
2555 
2556  /* If there is an EOF char, bind eof_char to it. */
2557  if (temp.t_eofc != -1)
2558  eof_char = temp.t_eofc;
2559 
2560 #if defined (NO_KILL_INTR)
2561  /* Get rid of C-\ and C-c. */
2562  temp.t_intrc = temp.t_quitc = -1;
2563 #endif /* NO_KILL_INTR */
2564 
2565  ioctl (tty, TIOCSETC, &temp);
2566  }
2567 #endif /* TIOCGETC */
2568 
2569 #if defined (TIOCGLTC)
2570  {
2571  struct ltchars temp;
2572 
2573  ioctl (tty, TIOCGLTC, &original_ltchars);
2574  temp = original_ltchars;
2575 
2576  /* Make the interrupt keys go away. Just enough to make people
2577  happy. */
2578  temp.t_dsuspc = -1; /* C-y */
2579  temp.t_lnextc = -1; /* C-v */
2580 
2581  ioctl (tty, TIOCSLTC, &temp);
2582  }
2583 #endif /* TIOCGLTC */
2584 
2585  the_ttybuff.sg_flags &= ~(ECHO | CRMOD);
2586  the_ttybuff.sg_flags |= CBREAK;
2587  ioctl (tty, TIOCSETN, &the_ttybuff);
2588 
2589  terminal_prepped = 1;
2590 
2591  SIGNALS_RESTORE (saved_signals);
2592 #endif /* !__GO32__ */
2593 }
2594 
2595 /* Restore the terminal to its original state. */
2596 static void
2597 rl_deprep_terminal ()
2598 {
2599 #if !defined(__GO32s__) && !defined(WIN32)
2600  int tty = fileno (rl_instream);
2601  SIGNALS_DECLARE_SAVED (saved_signals);
2602 
2603  if (!terminal_prepped)
2604  return;
2605 
2606  SIGNALS_BLOCK (SIGINT, saved_signals);
2607 
2608  the_ttybuff.sg_flags = original_tty_flags;
2609  ioctl (tty, TIOCSETN, &the_ttybuff);
2610  readline_echoing_p = 1;
2611 
2612 #if defined (TIOCLGET)
2613  ioctl (tty, TIOCLSET, &local_mode_flags);
2614 #endif
2615 
2616 #if defined (TIOCSLTC)
2617  ioctl (tty, TIOCSLTC, &original_ltchars);
2618 #endif
2619 
2620 #if defined (TIOCSETC)
2621  ioctl (tty, TIOCSETC, &original_tchars);
2622 #endif
2623  terminal_prepped = 0;
2624 
2625  SIGNALS_RESTORE (saved_signals);
2626 #endif /* !__GO32 */
2627 }
2628 
2629 #else /* !defined (NEW_TTY_DRIVER) */
2630 
2631 #if !defined (VMIN)
2632 #define VMIN VEOF
2633 #endif
2634 
2635 #if !defined (VTIME)
2636 #define VTIME VEOL
2637 #endif
2638 
2639 #if !defined(__GO32__) && !defined(WIN32)
2640 #if defined (TERMIOS_TTY_DRIVER)
2641 static struct termios otio;
2642 #else
2643 static struct termio otio;
2644 #endif /* !TERMIOS_TTY_DRIVER */
2645 #endif /* __GO32__ */
2646 
2647 static void
2648 rl_prep_terminal ()
2649 {
2650 #ifdef WIN32
2651  winio_rdln_on();
2652 #endif
2653 #if !defined(__GO32__) && !defined(WIN32)
2654  int tty = fileno (rl_instream);
2655 #if defined (TERMIOS_TTY_DRIVER)
2656  struct termios tio;
2657 #else
2658  struct termio tio;
2659 #endif /* !TERMIOS_TTY_DRIVER */
2660 
2661  SIGNALS_DECLARE_SAVED (saved_signals);
2662 
2663  if (terminal_prepped)
2664  return;
2665 
2666  /* Try to keep this function from being INTerrupted. We can do it
2667  on POSIX and systems with BSD-like signal handling. */
2668  SIGNALS_BLOCK (SIGINT, saved_signals);
2669 
2670 #if defined (TERMIOS_TTY_DRIVER)
2671  tcgetattr (tty, &tio);
2672 #else
2673  ioctl (tty, TCGETA, &tio);
2674 #endif /* !TERMIOS_TTY_DRIVER */
2675 
2676  otio = tio;
2677 
2678  readline_echoing_p = (tio.c_lflag & ECHO);
2679 
2680  tio.c_lflag &= ~(ICANON|ECHO);
2681 
2682  if (otio.c_cc[VEOF] != _POSIX_VDISABLE)
2683  eof_char = otio.c_cc[VEOF];
2684 
2685 #if defined (USE_XON_XOFF)
2686 #if defined (IXANY)
2687  tio.c_iflag &= ~(IXON|IXOFF|IXANY);
2688 #else
2689  /* `strict' Posix systems do not define IXANY. */
2690  tio.c_iflag &= ~(IXON|IXOFF);
2691 #endif /* IXANY */
2692 #endif /* USE_XON_XOFF */
2693 
2694  /* Only turn this off if we are using all 8 bits. */
2695  /* |ISTRIP|INPCK */
2696  tio.c_iflag &= ~(ISTRIP | INPCK);
2697 
2698  /* Make sure we differentiate between CR and NL on input. */
2699  tio.c_iflag &= ~(ICRNL | INLCR);
2700 
2701 #if !defined (HANDLE_SIGNALS)
2702  tio.c_lflag &= ~ISIG;
2703 #else
2704  tio.c_lflag |= ISIG;
2705 #endif
2706 
2707  tio.c_cc[VMIN] = 1;
2708  tio.c_cc[VTIME] = 0;
2709 
2710  /* Turn off characters that we need on Posix systems with job control,
2711  just to be sure. This includes ^Y and ^V. This should not really
2712  be necessary. */
2713 #if defined (TERMIOS_TTY_DRIVER) && defined (_POSIX_JOB_CONTROL)
2714 
2715 #if defined (VLNEXT)
2716  tio.c_cc[VLNEXT] = _POSIX_VDISABLE;
2717 #endif
2718 
2719 #if defined (VDSUSP)
2720  tio.c_cc[VDSUSP] = _POSIX_VDISABLE;
2721 #endif
2722 
2723 #endif /* POSIX && JOB_CONTROL */
2724 
2725 #if defined (TERMIOS_TTY_DRIVER)
2726  tcsetattr (tty, TCSADRAIN, &tio);
2727  tcflow (tty, TCOON); /* Simulate a ^Q. */
2728 #else
2729  ioctl (tty, TCSETAW, &tio);
2730  ioctl (tty, TCXONC, 1); /* Simulate a ^Q. */
2731 #endif /* !TERMIOS_TTY_DRIVER */
2732 
2733  terminal_prepped = 1;
2734 
2735  SIGNALS_RESTORE (saved_signals);
2736 #endif /* !__GO32__ */
2737 }

2739 static void
2740 rl_deprep_terminal ()
2741 {
2742 #ifdef WIN32
2743  winio_rdln_off();
2744 #endif
2745 #if !defined(__GO32__) && !defined(WIN32)
2746  int tty = fileno (rl_instream);
2747 
2748  /* Try to keep this function from being INTerrupted. We can do it
2749  on POSIX and systems with BSD-like signal handling. */
2750  SIGNALS_DECLARE_SAVED (saved_signals);
2751 
2752  if (!terminal_prepped)
2753  return;
2754 
2755  SIGNALS_BLOCK (SIGINT, saved_signals);
2756 
2757 #if defined (TERMIOS_TTY_DRIVER)
2758  tcsetattr (tty, TCSADRAIN, &otio);
2759  tcflow (tty, TCOON); /* Simulate a ^Q. */
2760 #else /* TERMIOS_TTY_DRIVER */
2761  ioctl (tty, TCSETAW, &otio);
2762  ioctl (tty, TCXONC, 1); /* Simulate a ^Q. */
2763 #endif /* !TERMIOS_TTY_DRIVER */
2764 
2765  terminal_prepped = 0;
2766

2768 #endif /* !__GO32__ */

2779 /* Return 0 if C is not a member of the class of characters that belong
2780  in words, or 1 if it is. */
2781 
2782 int allow_pathname_alphabetic_chars = 0;
2783 char *pathname_alphabetic_chars = "/-_=~.#$";
2784 
2785 int
2786 alphabetic (c)
2787  int c;
2788 {
2789  if (pure_alphabetic (c) || (numeric (c)))
2790  return (1);
2791 
2792  if (allow_pathname_alphabetic_chars)
2793  return ((int)rindex (pathname_alphabetic_chars, c));
2794  else
2795  return (0);
2796 }

2798 /* Return non-zero if C is a numeric character. */
2799 int
2800 numeric (c)
2801  int c;
2802 {
2803  return (c >= '0' && c <= '9');
2804 }

2806 /* Ring the terminal bell. */
2807 int
2808 ding ()
2809 {
2810 #ifdef WIN32
2811 printf("\007");
2812 #else
2813  if (readline_echoing_p)
2814  {
2815 #ifndef __GO32__
2816  if (prefer_visible_bell && visible_bell)
2817  tputs (visible_bell, 1, output_character_function);
2818  else
2819 #endif /* !__GO32__ */
2820  {
2821  fprintf (stderr, "\007");
2822  fflush (stderr);
2823  }
2824  }
2825 #endif
2826  return (-1);
2827 }

2829 /* How to abort things. */
2830 rl_abort ()
2831 {
2832  ding ();
2833  rl_clear_message ();
2834  rl_init_argument ();
2835  rl_pending_input = 0;
2836 
2837  defining_kbd_macro = 0;
2838  while (executing_macro)
2839  pop_executing_macro ();
2840 
2841  rl_last_func = (Function *)NULL;
2842  longjmp (readline_top_level, 1);
2843 }
2844 
2845 /* Return a copy of the string between FROM and TO.
2846  FROM is inclusive, TO is not. */
2847 #if defined (sun) /* Yes, that's right, some crufty function in sunview is
2848  called rl_copy (). */
2849 static
2850 #endif
2851 char *
2852 rl_copy (from, to)
2853  int from, to;
2854 {
2855  register int length;
2856  char *copy;
2857 
2858  /* Fix it if the caller is confused. */
2859  if (from > to)
2860  {
2861  int t = from;
2862  from = to;
2863  to = t;
2864  }
2865 
2866  length = to - from;
2867  copy = (char *)xmalloc (1 + length);
2868  strncpy (copy, the_line + from, length);
2869  copy[length] = '\0';
2870  return (copy);
2871 }

2873 /* Increase the size of RL_LINE_BUFFER until it has enough space to hold
2874  LEN characters. */
2875 void
2876 rl_extend_line_buffer (len)
2877  int len;
2878 {
2879  while (len >= rl_line_buffer_len)
2880  rl_line_buffer =
2881  (char *)xrealloc
2882  (rl_line_buffer, rl_line_buffer_len += DEFAULT_BUFFER_SIZE);
2883 
2884  the_line = rl_line_buffer;
2885 }

2893 
2894 /* Insert a string of text into the line at point. This is the only
2895  way that you should do insertion. rl_insert () calls this
2896  function. */
2897 rl_insert_text (string)
2898  char *string;
2899 {
2900  extern int doing_an_undo;
2901  register int i, l = strlen (string);
2902  if (rl_end + l >= rl_line_buffer_len)
2903  rl_extend_line_buffer (rl_end + l);
2904 
2905  for (i = rl_end; i >= rl_point; i--)
2906  the_line[i + l] = the_line[i];
2907  strncpy (the_line + rl_point, string, l);
2908 
2909  /* Remember how to undo this if we aren't undoing something. */
2910  if (!doing_an_undo)
2911  {
2912  /* If possible and desirable, concatenate the undos. */
2913  if ((strlen (string) == 1) &&
2914  rl_undo_list &&
2915  (rl_undo_list->what == UNDO_INSERT) &&
2916  (rl_undo_list->end == rl_point) &&
2917  (rl_undo_list->end - rl_undo_list->start < 20))
2918  rl_undo_list->end++;
2919  else
2920  rl_add_undo (UNDO_INSERT, rl_point, rl_point + l, (char *)NULL);
2921  }
2922  rl_point += l;
2923  rl_end += l;
2924  the_line[rl_end] = '\0';
2925 }
2926 
2927 /* Delete the string between FROM and TO. FROM is
2928  inclusive, TO is not. */
2929 rl_delete_text (from, to)
2930  int from, to;
2931 {
2932  extern int doing_an_undo;
2933  register char *text;
2934 
2935  /* Fix it if the caller is confused. */
2936  if (from > to)
2937  {
2938  int t = from;
2939  from = to;
2940  to = t;
2941  }
2942  text = rl_copy (from, to);
2943  strncpy (the_line + from, the_line + to, rl_end - to);
2944 
2945  /* Remember how to undo this delete. */
2946  if (!doing_an_undo)
2947  rl_add_undo (UNDO_DELETE, from, to, text);
2948  else
2949  free (text);
2950 
2951  rl_end -= (to - from);
2952  the_line[rl_end] = '\0';
2953 }

2958 /* Readline character functions */
2959 /* */
2960 /* **************************************************************** */
2961 
2962 /* This is not a gap editor, just a stupid line input routine. No hair
2963  is involved in writing any of the functions, and none should be. */
2964 
2965 /* Note that:
2966 
2967  rl_end is the place in the string that we would place '\0';
2968  i.e., it is always safe to place '\0' there.
2969 
2970  rl_point is the place in the string where the cursor is. Sometimes
2971  this is the same as rl_end.
2972 
2973  Any command that is called interactively receives two arguments.
2974  The first is a count: the numeric arg pased to this command.
2975  The second is the key which invoked this command.
2976 */
2977

2980 /* */
2981 /* Movement Commands */
2982 /* */
2983 /* **************************************************************** */
2984 
2985 /* Note that if you `optimize' the display for these functions, you cannot
2986  use said functions in other functions which do not do optimizing display.
2987  I.e., you will have to update the data base for rl_redisplay, and you
2988  might as well let rl_redisplay do that job. */
2989 
2990 /* Move forward COUNT characters. */
2991 rl_forward (count)
2992  int count;
2993 {
2994  if (count < 0)
2995  rl_backward (-count);
2996  else
2997  while (count)
2998  {
2999 #if defined (VI_MODE)
3000  if (rl_point == (rl_end - (rl_editing_mode == vi_mode)))
3001 #else
3002  if (rl_point == rl_end)
3003 #endif /* VI_MODE */
3004  {
3005  ding ();
3006  return;
3007  }
3008  else
3009  rl_point++;
3010  --count;
3011  }
3012 }
3013 
3014 /* Move backward COUNT characters. */
3015 rl_backward (count)
3016  int count;
3017 {
3018  if (count < 0)
3019  rl_forward (-count);
3020  else
3021  while (count)
3022  {
3023  if (!rl_point)
3024  {
3025  ding ();
3026  return;
3027  }
3028  else
3029  --rl_point;
3030  --count;
3031  }
3032 }

3035 rl_beg_of_line ()
3036 {
3037  rl_point = 0;
3038 }

3041 rl_end_of_line ()

3045 
3046 /* Move forward a word. We do what Emacs does. */
3047 rl_forward_word (count)
3048  int count;
3049 {
3050  int c;
3051 
3052  if (count < 0)
3053  {
3054  rl_backward_word (-count);
3055  return;
3056  }
3057 
3058  while (count)
3059  {
3060  if (rl_point == rl_end)
3061  return;
3062 
3063  /* If we are not in a word, move forward until we are in one.
3064  Then, move forward until we hit a non-alphabetic character. */
3065  c = the_line[rl_point];
3066  if (!alphabetic (c))
3067  {
3068  while (++rl_point < rl_end)
3069  {
3070  c = the_line[rl_point];
3071  if (alphabetic (c)) break;
3072  }
3073  }
3074  if (rl_point == rl_end) return;
3075  while (++rl_point < rl_end)
3076  {
3077  c = the_line[rl_point];
3078  if (!alphabetic (c)) break;
3079  }
3080  --count;
3081  }
3082 }
3083 
3084 /* Move backward a word. We do what Emacs does. */
3085 rl_backward_word (count)
3086  int count;
3087 {
3088  int c;
3089 
3090  if (count < 0)
3091  {
3092  rl_forward_word (-count);
3093  return;
3094  }
3095 
3096  while (count)
3097  {
3098  if (!rl_point)
3099  return;
3100 
3101  /* Like rl_forward_word (), except that we look at the characters
3102  just before point. */
3103 
3104  c = the_line[rl_point - 1];
3105  if (!alphabetic (c))
3106  {
3107  while (--rl_point)
3108  {
3109  c = the_line[rl_point - 1];
3110  if (alphabetic (c)) break;
3111  }
3112  }
3113 
3114  while (rl_point)
3115  {
3116  c = the_line[rl_point - 1];
3117  if (!alphabetic (c))
3118  break;
3119  else --rl_point;
3120  }
3121  --count;
3122  }
3123 }

3219 /* Insert the character C at the current location, moving point forward. */
3220 rl_insert (count, c)
3221  int count, c;
3222 {
3223  register int i;
3224  char *string;
3225 #ifdef WIN32
3226  char dummy[5];
3227  dummy[0] = 0;
3228 #endif
3229  if (count <= 0)
3230  return;
3231 
3232  /* If we can optimize, then do it. But don't let people crash
3233  readline because of extra large arguments. */
3234  if (count > 1 && count < 1024)
3235  {
3236  string = (char *)alloca (1 + count);
3237 
3238  for (i = 0; i < count; i++)
3239  string[i] = c;
3240 
3241  string[i] = '\0';
3242  rl_insert_text (string);
3243  return;
3244  }
3245 
3246  if (count > 1024)
3247  {
3248  int decreaser;
3249 
3250  string = (char *)alloca (1024 + 1);
3251 
3252  for (i = 0; i < 1024; i++)
3253  string[i] = c;
3254 
3255  while (count)
3256  {
3257  decreaser = (count > 1024 ? 1024 : count);
3258  string[decreaser] = '\0';
3259  rl_insert_text (string);
3260  count -= decreaser;
3261  }
3262  return;
3263  }
3264 
3265  /* We are inserting a single character.
3266  If there is pending input, then make a string of all of the
3267  pending characters that are bound to rl_insert, and insert
3268  them all. */
3269  if (any_typein)
3270  {
3271  int key = 0, t;
3272 
3273  i = 0;
3274  string = (char *)alloca (ibuffer_len + 1);
3275  string[i++] = c;
3276 
3277  while ((t = rl_get_char (&key)) &&
3278  (keymap[key].type == ISFUNC &&
3279  keymap[key].function == rl_insert))
3280  string[i++] = key;
3281 
3282  if (t)
3283  rl_unget_char (key);
3284 
3285  string[i] = '\0';
3286  rl_insert_text (string);
3287  return;
3288  }
3289  else
3290  {
3291  /* Inserting a single character. */
3292  string = (char*)alloca (2);
3293  string[1] = '\0';
3294  string[0] = c;
3295  rl_insert_text (string);
3296  }
3297 }

3366 /* Rubout the character behind point. */
3367 rl_rubout (count)
3368  int count;
3369 {
3370  if (count < 0)
3371  {
3372  rl_delete (-count);
3373  return;
3374  }
3375 
3376  if (!rl_point)
3377  {
3378  ding ();
3379  return;
3380  }
3381 
3382  if (count > 1)
3383  {
3384  int orig_point = rl_point;
3385  rl_backward (count);
3386  rl_kill_text (orig_point, rl_point);
3387  }
3388  else
3389  {
3390  int c = the_line[--rl_point];
3391  rl_delete_text (rl_point, rl_point + 1);
3392 
3393  if (rl_point == rl_end && alphabetic (c) && last_c_pos)
3394  {
3395 
3396  backspace (1);
3397 #ifndef WIN32
3398 #if GRX
3399  if (egagrph) {
3400  grx_output_some_chars(" ", 1);
3401  }else
3402 #endif
3403  {
3404  putc (' ', out_stream);
3405  }
3406  backspace (1);
3407 #endif
3408  last_c_pos--;
3409  visible_line[last_c_pos] = '\0';
3410  rl_display_fixed++;
3411  }
3412  }
3413 }

3416  kill that many characters instead. */

3427  {

3429  return;
3430  }
3431

3433  {
3434  int orig_point = rl_point;
3435  rl_forward (count);
3436  rl_kill_text (orig_point, rl_point);
3437  rl_point = orig_point;
3438  }

3441 }

3450 /* The next two functions mimic unix line editing behaviour, except they
3451  save the deleted text on the kill ring. This is safer than not saving
3452  it, and since we have a ring, nobody should get screwed. */
3453 
3454 /* This does what C-w does in Unix. We can't prevent people from
3455  using behaviour that they expect. */
3456 rl_unix_word_rubout ()
3457 {
3458  if (!rl_point) ding ();
3459  else {
3460  int orig_point = rl_point;
3461  while (rl_point && whitespace (the_line[rl_point - 1]))
3462  rl_point--;
3463  while (rl_point && !whitespace (the_line[rl_point - 1]))
3464  rl_point--;
3465  rl_kill_text (rl_point, orig_point);
3466  }
3467 }

3469 /* Here is C-u doing what Unix does. You don't *have* to use these
3470  key-bindings. We have a choice of killing the entire line, or
3471  killing from where we are to the start of the line. We choose the
3472  latter, because if you are a Unix weenie, then you haven't backspaced
3473  into the line at all, and if you aren't, then you know what you are
3474  doing. */
3475 rl_unix_line_discard ()
3476 {
3477  if (!rl_point) ding ();
3478  else {
3479  rl_kill_text (rl_point, 0);
3480  rl_point = 0;
3481  }
3482 }

3499 
3500 /* The three kinds of things that we know how to do. */
3501 #define UpCase 1
3502 #define DownCase 2
3503 #define CapCase 3
3504 
3505 /* Uppercase the word at point. */

3509  rl_change_case (count, UpCase);
