3526 /* The meaty function.
3527  Change the case of COUNT words, performing OP on them.
3528  OP is one of UpCase, DownCase, or CapCase.
3529  If a negative argument is given, leave point where it started,
3530  otherwise, leave it where it moves to. */
3531 rl_change_case (count, op)
3532  int count, op;
3533 {
3534  register int start = rl_point, end;
3535  int state = 0;
3536 
3537  rl_forward_word (count);
3538  end = rl_point;
3539 
3540  if (count < 0)
3541  {
3542  int temp = start;
3543  start = end;
3544  end = temp;
3545  }
3546 
3547  /* We are going to modify some text, so let's prepare to undo it. */
3548  rl_modifying (start, end);
3549 
3550  for (; start < end; start++)
3551  {
3552  switch (op)
3553  {
3554  case UpCase:
3555  the_line[start] = to_upper (the_line[start]);
3556  break;
3557 
3558  case DownCase:
3559  the_line[start] = to_lower (the_line[start]);
3560  break;
3561 
3562  case CapCase:
3563  if (state == 0)
3564  {
3565  the_line[start] = to_upper (the_line[start]);
3566  state = 1;
3567  }
3568  else
3569  {
3570  the_line[start] = to_lower (the_line[start]);
3571  }
3572  if (!pure_alphabetic (the_line[start]))
3573  state = 0;
3574  break;
3575 
3576  default:
3577  abort ();
3578  }
3579  }
3580  rl_point = end;
3581 }
3582 
3583 /* **************************************************************** */
3584 /* */
3585 /* Transposition */
3586 /* */
3587 /* **************************************************************** */
3588 
3589 /* Transpose the words at point. */
3590 rl_transpose_words (count)
3591  int count;
3592 {
3593  char *word1, *word2;
3594  int w1_beg, w1_end, w2_beg, w2_end;
3595  int orig_point = rl_point;
3596 
3597  if (!count) return;
3598 
3599  /* Find the two words. */
3600  rl_forward_word (count);
3601  w2_end = rl_point;
3602  rl_backward_word (1);
3603  w2_beg = rl_point;
3604  rl_backward_word (count);
3605  w1_beg = rl_point;
3606  rl_forward_word (1);
3607  w1_end = rl_point;
3608 
3609  /* Do some check to make sure that there really are two words. */
3610  if ((w1_beg == w2_beg) || (w2_beg < w1_end))
3611  {
3612  ding ();
3613  rl_point = orig_point;
3614  return;
3615  }
3616 
3617  /* Get the text of the words. */
3618  word1 = rl_copy (w1_beg, w1_end);
3619  word2 = rl_copy (w2_beg, w2_end);
3620 
3621  /* We are about to do many insertions and deletions. Remember them
3622  as one operation. */
3623  rl_begin_undo_group ();
3624 
3625  /* Do the stuff at word2 first, so that we don't have to worry
3626  about word1 moving. */
3627  rl_point = w2_beg;
3628  rl_delete_text (w2_beg, w2_end);
3629  rl_insert_text (word1);
3630 
3631  rl_point = w1_beg;
3632  rl_delete_text (w1_beg, w1_end);
3633  rl_insert_text (word2);
3634 
3635  /* This is exactly correct since the text before this point has not
3636  changed in length. */
3637  rl_point = w2_end;
3638 
3639  /* I think that does it. */
3640  rl_end_undo_group ();
3641  free (word1); free (word2);
3642 }
3643 
3644 /* Transpose the characters at point. If point is at the end of the line,
3645  then transpose the characters before point. */
3646 rl_transpose_chars (count)
3647  int count;
3648 {
3649  if (!count)
3650  return;
3651 
3652  if (!rl_point || rl_end < 2) {
3653  ding ();
3654  return;
3655  }
3656 
3657  while (count)
3658  {
3659  if (rl_point == rl_end)
3660  {
3661  int t = the_line[rl_point - 1];
3662 
3663  the_line[rl_point - 1] = the_line[rl_point - 2];
3664  the_line[rl_point - 2] = t;
3665  }
3666  else
3667  {
3668  int t = the_line[rl_point];
3669 
3670  the_line[rl_point] = the_line[rl_point - 1];
3671  the_line[rl_point - 1] = t;
3672 
3673  if (count < 0 && rl_point)
3674  rl_point--;
3675  else
3676  rl_point++;
3677  }
3678 
3679  if (count < 0)
3680  count++;
3681  else
3682  count--;
3683  }
3684 }

3739 /* Completion matching, from readline's point of view. */

3743 /* Pointer to the generator function for completion_matches ().
3744  NULL means to use filename_entry_function (), the default filename
3745  completer. */
3746 Function *rl_completion_entry_function = (Function *)NULL;
3747 
3748 /* Pointer to alternative function to create matches.
3749  Function is called with TEXT, START, and END.
3750  START and END are indices in RL_LINE_BUFFER saying what the boundaries
3751  of TEXT are.
3752  If this function exists and returns NULL then call the value of
3753  rl_completion_entry_function to try to match, otherwise use the
3754  array of strings returned. */
3755 Function *rl_attempted_completion_function = (Function *)NULL;
3756 
3757 /* Local variable states what happened during the last completion attempt. */
3758 static int completion_changed_buffer = 0;
3759 
3760 /* Complete the word at or before point. You have supplied the function
3761  that does the initial simple matching selection algorithm (see
3762  completion_matches ()). The default is to do filename completion. */
3763 
3764 rl_complete (ignore, invoking_key)
3765  int ignore, invoking_key;
3766 {
3767  if (rl_last_func == rl_complete && !completion_changed_buffer)
3768  rl_complete_internal ('?');
3769  else
3770  rl_complete_internal (TAB);
3771 }
3772 
3773 /* List the possible completions. See description of rl_complete (). */
3774 rl_possible_completions ()
3775 {
3776  rl_complete_internal ('?');
3777 }
3778 
3779 /* The user must press "y" or "n". Non-zero return means "y" pressed. */
3780 get_y_or_n ()
3781 {
3782  int c;
3783  loop:
3784  c = rl_read_key ();
3785  if (c == 'y' || c == 'Y') return (1);
3786  if (c == 'n' || c == 'N') return (0);
3787  if (c == ABORT_CHAR) rl_abort ();
3788  ding (); goto loop;
3789 }
3790 
3791 /* Up to this many items will be displayed in response to a
3792  possible-completions call. After that, we ask the user if
3793  she is sure she wants to see them all. */
3794 int rl_completion_query_items = 100;
3795 
3796 /* The basic list of characters that signal a break between words for the
3797  completer routine. The contents of this variable is what breaks words
3798  in the shell, i.e. " \t\n\"\\'`@$><=" */
3799 char *rl_basic_word_break_characters = " \t\n\"\\'`@$><=;|&{(";
3800 
3801 /* The list of characters that signal a break between words for
3802  rl_complete_internal. The default list is the contents of
3803  rl_basic_word_break_characters. */
3804 char *rl_completer_word_break_characters = (char *)NULL;
3805 
3806 /* The list of characters which are used to quote a substring of the command
3807  line. Command completion occurs on the entire substring, and within the
3808  substring rl_completer_word_break_characters are treated as any other
3809  character, unless they also appear within this list. */
3810 char *rl_completer_quote_characters = (char *)NULL;
3811 
3812 /* List of characters that are word break characters, but should be left
3813  in TEXT when it is passed to the completion function. The shell uses
3814  this to help determine what kind of completing to do. */
3815 char *rl_special_prefixes = (char *)NULL;
3816 
3817 /* If non-zero, then disallow duplicates in the matches. */
3818 int rl_ignore_completion_duplicates = 1;
3819 
3820 /* Non-zero means that the results of the matches are to be treated
3821  as filenames. This is ALWAYS zero on entry, and can only be changed
3822  within a completion entry finder function. */
3823 int rl_filename_completion_desired = 0;
3824 
3825 /* This function, if defined, is called by the completer when real
3826  filename completion is done, after all the matching names have been
3827  generated. It is passed a (char**) known as matches in the code below.
3828  It consists of a NULL-terminated array of pointers to potential
3829  matching strings. The 1st element (matches[0]) is the maximal
3830  substring that is common to all matches. This function can re-arrange
3831  the list of matches as required, but all elements of the array must be
3832  free()'d if they are deleted. The main intent of this function is
3833  to implement FIGNORE a la SunOS csh. */
3834 Function *rl_ignore_some_completions_function = (Function *)NULL;
3835 
3836 /* Complete the word at or before point.
3837  WHAT_TO_DO says what to do with the completion.
3838  `?' means list the possible completions.
3839  TAB means do standard completion.
3840  `*' means insert all of the possible completions. */
3841 rl_complete_internal (what_to_do)
3842  int what_to_do;
3843 {
3844  char *filename_completion_function ();
3845  char **completion_matches (), **matches;
3846  Function *our_func;
3847  int start, scan, end, delimiter = 0;
3848  char *text, *saved_line_buffer;
3849  char quote_char = '\0';
3850  char *replacement;
3851 
3852  if (the_line)
3853  saved_line_buffer = savestring (the_line);
3854  else
3855  saved_line_buffer = (char *)NULL;
3856 
3857  if (rl_completion_entry_function)
3858  our_func = rl_completion_entry_function;
3859  else
3860  our_func = (int (*)())filename_completion_function;
3861 
3862  /* Only the completion entry function can change this. */
3863  rl_filename_completion_desired = 0;
3864 
3865  /* We now look backwards for the start of a filename/variable word. */
3866  end = rl_point;
3867 
3868  if (rl_point)
3869  {
3870  if (rl_completer_quote_characters)
3871  {
3872  /* We have a list of characters which can be used in pairs to quote
3873  substrings for completion. Try to find the start of an unclosed
3874  quoted substring.
3875  FIXME: Doesn't yet handle '\' escapes to hid embedded quotes */
3876  for (scan = 0; scan < end; scan++)
3877  {
3878  if (quote_char != '\0')
3879  {
3880  /* Ignore everything until the matching close quote char */
3881  if (the_line[scan] == quote_char)
3882  {
3883  /* Found matching close quote. Abandon this substring. */
3884  quote_char = '\0';
3885  rl_point = end;
3886  }
3887  }
3888  else if (rindex (rl_completer_quote_characters, the_line[scan]))
3889  {
3890  /* Found start of a quoted substring. */
3891  quote_char = the_line[scan];
3892  rl_point = scan + 1;
3893  }
3894  }
3895  }
3896  if (rl_point == end)
3897  {
3898  /* We didn't find an unclosed quoted substring upon which to do
3899  completion, so use the word break characters to find the
3900  substring on which to do completion. */
3901  while (--rl_point &&
3902  !rindex (rl_completer_word_break_characters,
3903  the_line[rl_point])) {;}
3904  }
3905 
3906  /* If we are at a word break, then advance past it. */
3907  if (rindex (rl_completer_word_break_characters, the_line[rl_point]))
3908  {
3909  /* If the character that caused the word break was a quoting
3910  character, then remember it as the delimiter. */
3911  if (rindex ("\"'", the_line[rl_point]) && (end - rl_point) > 1)
3912  delimiter = the_line[rl_point];
3913 
3914  /* If the character isn't needed to determine something special
3915  about what kind of completion to perform, then advance past it. */
3916 
3917  if (!rl_special_prefixes ||
3918  !rindex (rl_special_prefixes, the_line[rl_point]))
3919  rl_point++;
3920  }
3921  }
3922 
3923  start = rl_point;
3924  rl_point = end;
3925  text = rl_copy (start, end);
3926 
3927  /* If the user wants to TRY to complete, but then wants to give
3928  up and use the default completion function, they set the
3929  variable rl_attempted_completion_function. */
3930  if (rl_attempted_completion_function)
3931  {
3932  matches =
3933  (char **)(*rl_attempted_completion_function) (text, start, end);
3934 
3935  if (matches)
3936  {
3937  our_func = (Function *)NULL;
3938  goto after_usual_completion;
3939  }
3940  }
3941 
3942  matches = completion_matches (text, our_func);
3943 
3944  after_usual_completion:
3945  free (text);
3946 
3947  if (!matches)
3948  ding ();
3949  else
3950  {
3951  register int i;
3952 
3953  some_matches:
3954 
3955  /* It seems to me that in all the cases we handle we would like
3956  to ignore duplicate possibilities. Scan for the text to
3957  insert being identical to the other completions. */
3958  if (rl_ignore_completion_duplicates)
3959  {
3960  char *lowest_common;
3961  int j, newlen = 0;
3962 
3963  /* Sort the items. */
3964  /* It is safe to sort this array, because the lowest common
3965  denominator found in matches[0] will remain in place. */
3966  for (i = 0; matches[i]; i++);
3967  qsort (matches, i, sizeof (char *), compare_strings);
3968 
3969  /* Remember the lowest common denominator for it may be unique. */
3970  lowest_common = savestring (matches[0]);
3971 
3972  for (i = 0; matches[i + 1]; i++)
3973  {
3974  if (strcmp (matches[i], matches[i + 1]) == 0)
3975  {
3976  free (matches[i]);
3977  matches[i] = (char *)-1;
3978  }
3979  else
3980  newlen++;
3981  }
3982 
3983  /* We have marked all the dead slots with (char *)-1.
3984  Copy all the non-dead entries into a new array. */
3985  {
3986  char **temp_array =
3987  (char **)malloc ((3 + newlen) * sizeof (char *));
3988 
3989  for (i = 1, j = 1; matches[i]; i++)
3990  {
3991  if (matches[i] != (char *)-1)
3992  temp_array[j++] = matches[i];
3993  }
3994 
3995  temp_array[j] = (char *)NULL;
3996 
3997  if (matches[0] != (char *)-1)
3998  free (matches[0]);
3999 
4000  free (matches);
4001 
4002  matches = temp_array;
4003  }
4004 
4005  /* Place the lowest common denominator back in [0]. */
4006  matches[0] = lowest_common;
4007 
4008  /* If there is one string left, and it is identical to the
4009  lowest common denominator, then the LCD is the string to
4010  insert. */
4011  if (j == 2 && strcmp (matches[0], matches[1]) == 0)
4012  {
4013  free (matches[1]);
4014  matches[1] = (char *)NULL;
4015  }
4016  }
4017 
4018  switch (what_to_do)
4019  {
4020  case TAB:
4021  /* If we are matching filenames, then here is our chance to
4022  do clever processing by re-examining the list. Call the
4023  ignore function with the array as a parameter. It can
4024  munge the array, deleting matches as it desires. */
4025  if (rl_ignore_some_completions_function &&
4026  our_func == (int (*)())filename_completion_function)
4027  (void)(*rl_ignore_some_completions_function)(matches);
4028 
4029  /* If we are doing completions on quoted substrings, and any matches
4030  contain any of the completer word break characters, then auto-
4031  matically prepend the substring with a quote character (just
4032  pick the first one from the list of such) if it does not already
4033  begin with a quote string. FIXME: Need to remove any such
4034  automatically inserted quote character when it no longer is
4035  necessary, such as if we change the string we are completing on
4036  and the new set of matches don't require a quoted substring? */
4037 
4038  replacement = matches[0];
4039  if (matches[0] != NULL
4040  && rl_completer_quote_characters != NULL
4041  && (quote_char == '\0'))
4042  {
4043  for (i = 1; matches[i] != NULL; i++)
4044  {
4045  if (strpbrk (matches[i], rl_completer_word_break_characters))
4046  {
4047  /* Found an embedded word break character in a potential
4048  match, so need to prepend a quote character if we are
4049  replacing the completion string. */
4050  replacement = (char *)alloca (strlen (matches[0]) + 2);
4051  quote_char = *rl_completer_quote_characters;
4052  *replacement = quote_char;
4053  strcpy (replacement + 1, matches[0]);
4054  break;
4055  }
4056  }
4057  }
4058  if (replacement)
4059  {
4060  rl_delete_text (start, rl_point);
4061  rl_point = start;
4062  rl_insert_text (replacement);
4063  }
4064 
4065  /* If there are more matches, ring the bell to indicate.
4066  If this was the only match, and we are hacking files,
4067  check the file to see if it was a directory. If so,
4068  add a '/' to the name. If not, and we are at the end
4069  of the line, then add a space. */
4070  if (matches[1])
4071  {
4072  ding (); /* There are other matches remaining. */
4073  }
4074  else
4075  {
4076  char temp_string[16];
4077  int temp_index = 0;
4078 
4079  if (quote_char)
4080  {
4081  temp_string[temp_index++] = quote_char;
4082  }
4083  temp_string[temp_index++] = delimiter ? delimiter : ' ';
4084  temp_string[temp_index++] = '\0';
4085 
4086  if (rl_filename_completion_desired)
4087  {
4088  struct stat finfo;
4089  char *filename = tilde_expand (matches[0]);
4090 
4091  if ((stat (filename, &finfo) == 0) &&
4092  S_ISDIR (finfo.st_mode))
4093  {
4094  if (the_line[rl_point] != '/')
4095  rl_insert_text ("/");
4096  }
4097  else
4098  {
4099  if (rl_point == rl_end)
4100  rl_insert_text (temp_string);
4101  }
4102  free (filename);
4103  }
4104  else
4105  {
4106  if (rl_point == rl_end)
4107  rl_insert_text (temp_string);
4108  }
4109  }
4110  break;
4111 
4112  case '*':
4113  {
4114  int i = 1;
4115 
4116  rl_delete_text (start, rl_point);
4117  rl_point = start;
4118  rl_begin_undo_group ();
4119  if (matches[1])
4120  {
4121  while (matches[i])
4122  {
4123  rl_insert_text (matches[i++]);
4124  rl_insert_text (" ");
4125  }
4126  }
4127  else
4128  {
4129  rl_insert_text (matches[0]);
4130  rl_insert_text (" ");
4131  }
4132  rl_end_undo_group ();
4133  }
4134  break;
4135 
4136  case '?':
4137  {
4138  int len, count, limit, max = 0;
4139  int j, k, l;
4140 
4141  /* Handle simple case first. What if there is only one answer? */
4142  if (!matches[1])
4143  {
4144  char *temp;
4145 
4146  if (rl_filename_completion_desired)
4147  temp = rindex (matches[0], '/');
4148  else
4149  temp = (char *)NULL;
4150 
4151  if (!temp)
4152  temp = matches[0];
4153  else
4154  temp++;
4155 
4156  crlf ();
4157  fprintf (out_stream, "%s", temp);
4158  crlf ();
4159  goto restart;
4160  }
4161 
4162  /* There is more than one answer. Find out how many there are,
4163  and find out what the maximum printed length of a single entry
4164  is. */
4165  for (i = 1; matches[i]; i++)
4166  {
4167  char *temp = (char *)NULL;
4168 
4169  /* If we are hacking filenames, then only count the characters
4170  after the last slash in the pathname. */
4171  if (rl_filename_completion_desired)
4172  temp = rindex (matches[i], '/');
4173  else
4174  temp = (char *)NULL;
4175 
4176  if (!temp)
4177  temp = matches[i];
4178  else
4179  temp++;
4180 
4181  if (strlen (temp) > max)
4182  max = strlen (temp);
4183  }
4184 
4185  len = i;
4186 
4187  /* If there are many items, then ask the user if she
4188  really wants to see them all. */
4189  if (len >= rl_completion_query_items)
4190  {
4191  crlf ();
4192  fprintf (out_stream,
4193  "There are %d possibilities. Do you really", len);
4194  crlf ();
4195  fprintf (out_stream, "wish to see them all? (y or n)");
4196  fflush (out_stream);
4197  if (!get_y_or_n ())
4198  {
4199  crlf ();
4200  goto restart;
4201  }
4202  }
4203  /* How many items of MAX length can we fit in the screen window? */
4204  max += 2;
4205  limit = screenwidth / max;
4206  if (limit != 1 && (limit * max == screenwidth))
4207  limit--;
4208 
4209  /* Avoid a possible floating exception. If max > screenwidth,
4210  limit will be 0 and a divide-by-zero fault will result. */
4211  if (limit == 0)
4212  limit = 1;
4213 
4214  /* How many iterations of the printing loop? */
4215  count = (len + (limit - 1)) / limit;
4216 
4217  /* Watch out for special case. If LEN is less than LIMIT, then
4218  just do the inner printing loop. */
4219  if (len < limit) count = 1;
4220 
4221  /* Sort the items if they are not already sorted. */
4222  if (!rl_ignore_completion_duplicates)
4223  qsort (matches, len, sizeof (char *), compare_strings);
4224 
4225  /* Print the sorted items, up-and-down alphabetically, like
4226  ls might. */
4227  crlf ();
4228 
4229  for (i = 1; i < count + 1; i++)
4230  {
4231  for (j = 0, l = i; j < limit; j++)
4232  {
4233  if (l > len || !matches[l])
4234  {
4235  break;
4236  }
4237  else
4238  {
4239  char *temp = (char *)NULL;
4240 
4241  if (rl_filename_completion_desired)
4242  temp = rindex (matches[l], '/');
4243  else
4244  temp = (char *)NULL;
4245 
4246  if (!temp)
4247  temp = matches[l];
4248  else
4249  temp++;
4250 
4251  fprintf (out_stream, "%s", temp);
4252  for (k = 0; k < max - strlen (temp); k++)
4253  putc (' ', out_stream);
4254  }
4255  l += count;
4256  }
4257  crlf ();
4258  }
4259  restart:
4260 
4261  rl_on_new_line ();
4262  }
4263  break;
4264 
4265  default:
4266  abort ();
4267  }
4268 
4269  for (i = 0; matches[i]; i++)
4270  free (matches[i]);
4271  free (matches);
4272  }
4273 
4274  /* Check to see if the line has changed through all of this manipulation. */
4275  if (saved_line_buffer)
4276  {
4277  if (strcmp (the_line, saved_line_buffer) != 0)
4278  completion_changed_buffer = 1;
4279  else
4280  completion_changed_buffer = 0;
4281 
4282  free (saved_line_buffer);
4283  }
4284 }
4285 
4286 /* Stupid comparison routine for qsort () ing strings. */
4287 static int
4288 compare_strings (s1, s2)
4289  char **s1, **s2;
4290 {
4291  return (strcmp (*s1, *s2));
4292 }

4294 /* A completion function for usernames.
4295  TEXT contains a partial username preceded by a random
4296  character (usually `~'). */
4297 char *
4298 username_completion_function (text, state)
4299  int state;
4300  char *text;
4301 {
4302 #if defined(__GO32__) || defined(WIN32)
4303  return (char *)NULL;
4304 #else /* !__GO32__ */
4305  static char *username = (char *)NULL;
4306  static struct passwd *entry;
4307  static int namelen, first_char, first_char_loc;
4308 
4309  if (!state)
4310  {
4311  if (username)
4312  free (username);
4313 
4314  first_char = *text;
4315 
4316  if (first_char == '~')
4317  first_char_loc = 1;
4318  else
4319  first_char_loc = 0;
4320 
4321  username = savestring (&text[first_char_loc]);
4322  namelen = strlen (username);
4323  setpwent ();
4324  }
4325 
4326  while (entry = getpwent ())
4327  {
4328  if (strncmp (username, entry->pw_name, namelen) == 0)
4329  break;
4330  }
4331 
4332  if (!entry)
4333  {
4334  endpwent ();
4335  return ((char *)NULL);
4336  }
4337  else
4338  {
4339  char *value = (char *)xmalloc (2 + strlen (entry->pw_name));
4340 
4341  *value = *text;
4342 
4343  strcpy (value + first_char_loc, entry->pw_name);
4344 
4345  if (first_char == '~')
4346  rl_filename_completion_desired = 1;
4347 
4348  return (value);
4349  }
4350 #endif /* !__GO32__ */
4351 }

4353 /* **************************************************************** */
4354 /* */
4355 /* Undo, and Undoing */
4356 /* */
4357 /* **************************************************************** */
4358 
4359 /* Non-zero tells rl_delete_text and rl_insert_text to not add to
4360  the undo list. */
4361 int doing_an_undo = 0;
4362 
4363 /* The current undo list for THE_LINE. */
4364 UNDO_LIST *rl_undo_list = (UNDO_LIST *)NULL;
4365 
4366 /* Remember how to undo something. Concatenate some undos if that
4367  seems right. */
4368 rl_add_undo (what, start, end, text)
4369  enum undo_code what;
4370  int start, end;
4371  char *text;
4372 {
4373  UNDO_LIST *temp = (UNDO_LIST *)xmalloc (sizeof (UNDO_LIST));
4374  temp->what = what;
4375  temp->start = start;
4376  temp->end = end;
4377  temp->text = text;
4378  temp->next = rl_undo_list;
4379  rl_undo_list = temp;
4380 }
4381 
4382 /* Free the existing undo list. */
4383 free_undo_list ()
4384 {
4385  while (rl_undo_list) {
4386  UNDO_LIST *release = rl_undo_list;
4387  rl_undo_list = rl_undo_list->next;
4388 
4389  if (release->what == UNDO_DELETE)
4390  free (release->text);
4391 
4392  free (release);
4393  }
4394 }
4395 
4396 /* Undo the next thing in the list. Return 0 if there
4397  is nothing to undo, or non-zero if there was. */
4398 int
4399 rl_do_undo ()
4400 {
4401  UNDO_LIST *release;
4402  int waiting_for_begin = 0;
4403 
4404 undo_thing:
4405  if (!rl_undo_list)
4406  return (0);
4407 
4408  doing_an_undo = 1;
4409 
4410  switch (rl_undo_list->what) {
4411 
4412  /* Undoing deletes means inserting some text. */
4413  case UNDO_DELETE:
4414  rl_point = rl_undo_list->start;
4415  rl_insert_text (rl_undo_list->text);
4416  free (rl_undo_list->text);
4417  break;
4418 
4419  /* Undoing inserts means deleting some text. */
4420  case UNDO_INSERT:
4421  rl_delete_text (rl_undo_list->start, rl_undo_list->end);
4422  rl_point = rl_undo_list->start;
4423  break;
4424 
4425  /* Undoing an END means undoing everything 'til we get to
4426  a BEGIN. */
4427  case UNDO_END:
4428  waiting_for_begin++;
4429  break;
4430 
4431  /* Undoing a BEGIN means that we are done with this group. */
4432  case UNDO_BEGIN:
4433  if (waiting_for_begin)
4434  waiting_for_begin--;
4435  else
4436  abort ();
4437  break;
4438  }
4439 
4440  doing_an_undo = 0;
4441 
4442  release = rl_undo_list;
4443  rl_undo_list = rl_undo_list->next;
4444  free (release);
4445 
4446  if (waiting_for_begin)
4447  goto undo_thing;
4448 
4449  return (1);
4450 }
4451 
4452 /* Begin a group. Subsequent undos are undone as an atomic operation. */
4453 rl_begin_undo_group ()
4454 {
4455  rl_add_undo (UNDO_BEGIN, 0, 0, 0);
4456 }
4457 
4458 /* End an undo group started with rl_begin_undo_group (). */
4459 rl_end_undo_group ()
4460 {
4461  rl_add_undo (UNDO_END, 0, 0, 0);
4462 }
4463 
4464 /* Save an undo entry for the text from START to END. */
4465 rl_modifying (start, end)
4466  int start, end;
4467 {
4468  if (start > end)
4469  {
4470  int t = start;
4471  start = end;
4472  end = t;
4473  }
4474 
4475  if (start != end)
4476  {
4477  char *temp = rl_copy (start, end);
4478  rl_begin_undo_group ();
4479  rl_add_undo (UNDO_DELETE, start, end, temp);
4480  rl_add_undo (UNDO_INSERT, start, end, (char *)NULL);
4481  rl_end_undo_group ();
4482  }
4483 }
4484 
4485 /* Revert the current line to its previous state. */
4486 rl_revert_line ()
4487 {
4488  if (!rl_undo_list) ding ();
4489  else {
4490  while (rl_undo_list)
4491  rl_do_undo ();
4492  }
4493 }
4494 
4495 /* Do some undoing of things that were done. */
4496 rl_undo_command (count)
4497 {
4498  if (count < 0) return; /* Nothing to do. */
4499 
4500  while (count)
4501  {
4502  if (rl_do_undo ())
4503  {
4504  count--;
4505  }
4506  else
4507  {
4508  ding ();
4509  break;
4510  }
4511  }
4512 }

4514 /* **************************************************************** */
4515 /* */
4516 /* History Utilities */
4517 /* */
4518 /* **************************************************************** */
4519 
4520 /* We already have a history library, and that is what we use to control
4521  the history features of readline. However, this is our local interface
4522  to the history mechanism. */
4523 
4524 /* While we are editing the history, this is the saved
4525  version of the original line. */
4526 HIST_ENTRY *saved_line_for_history = (HIST_ENTRY *)NULL;
4527 
4528 /* Set the history pointer back to the last entry in the history. */
4529 start_using_history ()
4530 {
4531  using_history ();
4532  if (saved_line_for_history)
4533  free_history_entry (saved_line_for_history);
4534 
4535  saved_line_for_history = (HIST_ENTRY *)NULL;
4536 }
4537 
4538 /* Free the contents (and containing structure) of a HIST_ENTRY. */
4539 free_history_entry (entry)
4540  HIST_ENTRY *entry;
4541 {
4542  if (!entry) return;
4543  if (entry->line)
4544  free (entry->line);
4545  free (entry);
4546 }
4547 
4548 /* Perhaps put back the current line if it has changed. */
4549 maybe_replace_line ()
4550 {
4551  HIST_ENTRY *temp = current_history ();
4552 
4553  /* If the current line has changed, save the changes. */
4554  if (temp && ((UNDO_LIST *)(temp->data) != rl_undo_list))
4555  {
4556  temp = replace_history_entry (where_history (), the_line, rl_undo_list);
4557  free (temp->line);
4558  free (temp);
4559  }
4560 }
4561 
4562 /* Put back the saved_line_for_history if there is one. */
4563 maybe_unsave_line ()
4564 {
4565  if (saved_line_for_history)
4566  {
4567  int line_len;
4568 
4569  line_len = strlen (saved_line_for_history->line);
4570 
4571  if (line_len >= rl_line_buffer_len)
4572  rl_extend_line_buffer (line_len);
4573 
4574  strcpy (the_line, saved_line_for_history->line);
4575  rl_undo_list = (UNDO_LIST *)saved_line_for_history->data;
4576  free_history_entry (saved_line_for_history);
4577  saved_line_for_history = (HIST_ENTRY *)NULL;
4578  rl_end = rl_point = strlen (the_line);
4579  }
4580  else
4581  ding ();
4582 }
4583 
4584 /* Save the current line in saved_line_for_history. */
4585 maybe_save_line ()
4586 {
4587  if (!saved_line_for_history)
4588  {
4589  saved_line_for_history = (HIST_ENTRY *)xmalloc (sizeof (HIST_ENTRY));
4590  saved_line_for_history->line = savestring (the_line);
4591  saved_line_for_history->data = (char *)rl_undo_list;
4592  }
4593 }

4600 
4601 /* Meta-< goes to the start of the history. */
4602 rl_beginning_of_history ()
4603 {
4604  rl_get_previous_history (1 + where_history ());
4605 }
4606 
4607 /* Meta-> goes to the end of the history. (The current line). */
4608 rl_end_of_history ()
4609 {
4610  maybe_replace_line ();
4611  using_history ();
4612  maybe_unsave_line ();
4613 }
4614 
4615 /* Move down to the next history line. */
4616 rl_get_next_history (count)
4617  int count;
4618 {
4619  HIST_ENTRY *temp = (HIST_ENTRY *)NULL;
4620 
4621  if (count < 0)
4622  {
4623  rl_get_previous_history (-count);
4624  return;
4625  }
4626 
4627  if (!count)
4628  return;
4629 
4630  maybe_replace_line ();
4631 
4632  while (count)
4633  {
4634  temp = next_history ();
4635  if (!temp)
4636  break;
4637  --count;
4638  }
4639 
4640  if (!temp)
4641  maybe_unsave_line ();
4642  else
4643  {
4644  int line_len;
4645 
4646  line_len = strlen (temp->line);
4647 
4648  if (line_len >= rl_line_buffer_len)
4649  rl_extend_line_buffer (line_len);
4650 
4651  strcpy (the_line, temp->line);
4652  rl_undo_list = (UNDO_LIST *)temp->data;
4653  rl_end = rl_point = strlen (the_line);
4654 #if defined (VI_MODE)
4655  if (rl_editing_mode == vi_mode)
4656  rl_point = 0;
4657 #endif /* VI_MODE */
4658  }
4659 }
4660 
4661 /* Get the previous item out of our interactive history, making it the current
4662  line. If there is no previous history, just ding. */
4663 rl_get_previous_history (count)
4664  int count;
4665 {
4666  HIST_ENTRY *old_temp = (HIST_ENTRY *)NULL;
4667  HIST_ENTRY *temp = (HIST_ENTRY *)NULL;
4668 
4669  if (count < 0)
4670  {
4671  rl_get_next_history (-count);
4672  return;
4673  }
4674 
4675  if (!count)
4676  return;
4677 
4678  /* If we don't have a line saved, then save this one. */
4679  maybe_save_line ();
4680 
4681  /* If the current line has changed, save the changes. */
4682  maybe_replace_line ();
4683 
4684  while (count)
4685  {
4686  temp = previous_history ();
4687  if (!temp)
4688  break;
4689  else
4690  old_temp = temp;
4691  --count;
4692  }
4693 
4694  /* If there was a large argument, and we moved back to the start of the
4695  history, that is not an error. So use the last value found. */
4696  if (!temp && old_temp)
4697  temp = old_temp;
4698 
4699  if (!temp)
4700  ding ();
4701  else
4702  {
4703  int line_len;
4704 
4705  line_len = strlen (temp->line);
4706 
4707  if (line_len >= rl_line_buffer_len)
4708  rl_extend_line_buffer (line_len);
4709 
4710  strcpy (the_line, temp->line);
4711  rl_undo_list = (UNDO_LIST *)temp->data;
4712  rl_end = rl_point = line_len;
4713 
4714 #if defined (VI_MODE)
4715  if (rl_editing_mode == vi_mode)
4716  rl_point = 0;
4717 #endif /* VI_MODE */
4718  }
4719 }
4720

4723 /* */
4724 /* I-Search and Searching */
4725 /* */
4726 /* **************************************************************** */
4727 
4728 /* Search backwards through the history looking for a string which is typed
4729  interactively. Start with the current line. */
4730 rl_reverse_search_history (sign, key)
4731  int sign;
4732  int key;
4733 {
4734  rl_search_history (-sign, key);
4735 }
4736 
4737 /* Search forwards through the history looking for a string which is typed
4738  interactively. Start with the current line. */
4739 rl_forward_search_history (sign, key)
4740  int sign;
4741  int key;
4742 {
4743  rl_search_history (sign, key);
4744 }
4745 
4746 /* Display the current state of the search in the echo-area.
4747  SEARCH_STRING contains the string that is being searched for,
4748  DIRECTION is zero for forward, or 1 for reverse,
4749  WHERE is the history list number of the current line. If it is
4750  -1, then this line is the starting one. */
4751 rl_display_search (search_string, reverse_p, where)
4752  char *search_string;
4753  int reverse_p, where;
4754 {
4755  char *message = (char *)NULL;
4756 #ifdef WIN32
4757  char dummy[5];
4758  dummy[0] = 0;
4759 #endif
4760 
4761  message =
4762  (char *)alloca (1 + (search_string ? strlen (search_string) : 0) + 30);
4763 
4764  *message = '\0';
4765 
4766 #if defined (NOTDEF)
4767  if (where != -1)
4768  sprintf (message, "[%d]", where + history_base);
4769 #endif /* NOTDEF */
4770 
4771  strcat (message, "(");
4772 
4773  if (reverse_p)
4774  strcat (message, "reverse-");
4775 
4776  strcat (message, "i-search)`");
4777 
4778  if (search_string)
4779  strcat (message, search_string);
4780 
4781  strcat (message, "': ");
4782  rl_message (message, 0, 0);
4783  rl_redisplay ();
4784 }
4785 
4786 /* Search through the history looking for an interactively typed string.
4787  This is analogous to i-search. We start the search in the current line.
4788  DIRECTION is which direction to search; >= 0 means forward, < 0 means
4789  backwards. */
4790 rl_search_history (direction, invoking_key)
4791  int direction;
4792  int invoking_key;
4793 {
4794  /* The string that the user types in to search for. */
4795  char *search_string = (char *)alloca (128);
4796 
4797  /* The current length of SEARCH_STRING. */
4798  int search_string_index;
4799 
4800  /* The list of lines to search through. */
4801  char **lines;
4802 
4803  /* The length of LINES. */
4804  int hlen;
4805 
4806  /* Where we get LINES from. */
4807  HIST_ENTRY **hlist = history_list ();
4808 
4809  register int i = 0;
4810  int orig_point = rl_point;
4811  int orig_line = where_history ();
4812  int last_found_line = orig_line;
4813  int c, done = 0;
4814 
4815  /* The line currently being searched. */
4816  char *sline;
4817 
4818  /* Offset in that line. */
4819  int index;
4820 
4821  /* Non-zero if we are doing a reverse search. */
4822  int reverse = (direction < 0);
4823 
4824  /* Create an arrary of pointers to the lines that we want to search. */
4825  maybe_replace_line ();
4826  if (hlist)
4827  for (i = 0; hlist[i]; i++);
4828 
4829  /* Allocate space for this many lines, +1 for the current input line,
4830  and remember those lines. */
4831  lines = (char **)alloca ((1 + (hlen = i)) * sizeof (char *));
4832  for (i = 0; i < hlen; i++)
4833  lines[i] = hlist[i]->line;
4834 
4835  if (saved_line_for_history)
4836  lines[i] = saved_line_for_history->line;
4837  else
4838  /* So I have to type it in this way instead. */
4839  {
4840  char *alloced_line;
4841 
4842  /* Keep that mips alloca happy. */
4843  alloced_line = (char *)alloca (1 + strlen (the_line));
4844  lines[i] = alloced_line;
4845  strcpy (lines[i], &the_line[0]);
4846  }
4847 
4848  hlen++;
4849 
4850  /* The line where we start the search. */
4851  i = orig_line;
4852 
4853  /* Initialize search parameters. */
4854  *search_string = '\0';
4855  search_string_index = 0;
4856 
4857  /* Normalize DIRECTION into 1 or -1. */
4858  if (direction >= 0)
4859  direction = 1;
4860  else
4861  direction = -1;
4862 
4863  rl_display_search (search_string, reverse, -1);
4864 
4865  sline = the_line;
4866  index = rl_point;
4867 
4868  while (!done)
4869  {
4870  c = rl_read_key ();
4871 
4872  /* Hack C to Do What I Mean. */
4873  {
4874  Function *f = (Function *)NULL;
4875 
4876  if (keymap[c].type == ISFUNC)
4877  {
4878  f = keymap[c].function;
4879 
4880  if (f == rl_reverse_search_history)
4881  c = reverse ? -1 : -2;
4882  else if (f == rl_forward_search_history)
4883  c = !reverse ? -1 : -2;
4884  }
4885  }
4886 
4887  switch (c)
4888  {
4889  case ESC:
4890  done = 1;
4891  continue;
4892 
4893  /* case invoking_key: */
4894  case -1:
4895  goto search_again;
4896 
4897  /* switch directions */
4898  case -2:
4899  direction = -direction;
4900  reverse = (direction < 0);
4901 
4902  goto do_search;
4903 
4904  case CTRL ('G'):
4905  strcpy (the_line, lines[orig_line]);
4906  rl_point = orig_point;
4907  rl_end = strlen (the_line);
4908  rl_clear_message ();
4909  return;
4910 
4911  default:
4912  if (c < 32 || c > 126)
4913  {
4914  rl_execute_next (c);
4915  done = 1;
4916  continue;
4917  }
4918  else
4919  {
4920  search_string[search_string_index++] = c;
4921  search_string[search_string_index] = '\0';
4922  goto do_search;
4923 
4924  search_again:
4925 
4926  if (!search_string_index)
4927  continue;
4928  else
4929  {
4930  if (reverse)
4931  --index;
4932  else
4933  if (index != strlen (sline))
4934  ++index;
4935  else
4936  ding ();
4937  }
4938  do_search:
4939 
4940  while (1)
4941  {
4942  if (reverse)
4943  {
4944  while (index >= 0)
4945  if (strncmp
4946  (search_string, sline + index, search_string_index)
4947  == 0)
4948  goto string_found;
4949  else
4950  index--;
4951  }
4952  else
4953  {
4954  register int limit =
4955  (strlen (sline) - search_string_index) + 1;
4956 
4957  while (index < limit)
4958  {
4959  if (strncmp (search_string,
4960  sline + index,
4961  search_string_index) == 0)
4962  goto string_found;
4963  index++;
4964  }
4965  }
4966 
4967  next_line:
4968  i += direction;
4969 
4970  /* At limit for direction? */
4971  if ((reverse && i < 0) ||
4972  (!reverse && i == hlen))
4973  goto search_failed;
4974 
4975  sline = lines[i];
4976  if (reverse)
4977  index = strlen (sline);
4978  else
4979  index = 0;
4980 
4981  /* If the search string is longer than the current
4982  line, no match. */
4983  if (search_string_index > strlen (sline))
4984  goto next_line;
4985 
4986  /* Start actually searching. */
4987  if (reverse)
4988  index -= search_string_index;
4989  }
4990 
4991  search_failed:
4992  /* We cannot find the search string. Ding the bell. */
4993  ding ();
4994  i = last_found_line;
4995  break;
4996 
4997  string_found:
4998  /* We have found the search string. Just display it. But don't
4999  actually move there in the history list until the user accepts
5000  the location. */
5001  {
5002  int line_len;
5003 
5004  line_len = strlen (lines[i]);
5005 
5006  if (line_len >= rl_line_buffer_len)
5007  rl_extend_line_buffer (line_len);
5008 
5009  strcpy (the_line, lines[i]);
5010  rl_point = index;
5011  rl_end = line_len;
5012  last_found_line = i;
5013  rl_display_search
5014  (search_string, reverse, (i == orig_line) ? -1 : i);
5015  }
5016  }
5017  }
5018  continue;
5019  }
5020 
5021  /* The searching is over. The user may have found the string that she
5022  was looking for, or else she may have exited a failing search. If
5023  INDEX is -1, then that shows that the string searched for was not
5024  found. We use this to determine where to place rl_point. */
5025  {
5026  int now = last_found_line;
5027 
5028  /* First put back the original state. */
5029  strcpy (the_line, lines[orig_line]);
5030 
5031  if (now < orig_line)
5032  rl_get_previous_history (orig_line - now);
5033  else
5034  rl_get_next_history (now - orig_line);
5035 
5036  /* If the index of the "matched" string is less than zero, then the
5037  final search string was never matched, so put point somewhere
5038  reasonable. */
5039  if (index < 0)
5040  index = strlen (the_line);
5041 
5042  rl_point = index;
5043  rl_clear_message ();
5044  }
5045 }
5046 
5047 /* Make C be the next command to be executed. */
5048 rl_execute_next (c)
5049  int c;
5050 {
5051  rl_pending_input = c;
5052 }
5053 
5054 /* **************************************************************** */
5055 /* */
5056 /* Killing Mechanism */
5057 /* */
5058 /* **************************************************************** */
5059 
5060 /* What we assume for a max number of kills. */
5061 #define DEFAULT_MAX_KILLS 10
5062 
5063 /* The real variable to look at to find out when to flush kills. */
5064 int rl_max_kills = DEFAULT_MAX_KILLS;
5065 
5066 /* Where to store killed text. */
5067 char **rl_kill_ring = (char **)NULL;
5068 
5069 /* Where we are in the kill ring. */
5070 int rl_kill_index = 0;
5071 
5072 /* How many slots we have in the kill ring. */
5073 int rl_kill_ring_length = 0;
5074 
5075 /* How to say that you only want to save a certain amount
5076  of kill material. */
5077 rl_set_retained_kills (num)
5078  int num;
5079 {}
5080 
5081 /* The way to kill something. This appends or prepends to the last
5082  kill, if the last command was a kill command. if FROM is less
5083  than TO, then the text is appended, otherwise prepended. If the
5084  last command was not a kill command, then a new slot is made for
5085  this kill. */
5086 rl_kill_text (from, to)
5087  int from, to;
5088 {
5089  int slot;
5090  char *text = rl_copy (from, to);
5091 
5092  /* Is there anything to kill? */
5093  if (from == to)
5094  {
5095  free (text);
5096  last_command_was_kill++;
5097  return;
5098  }
5099 
5100  /* Delete the copied text from the line. */
5101  rl_delete_text (from, to);
5102 
5103  /* First, find the slot to work with. */
5104  if (!last_command_was_kill)
5105  {
5106  /* Get a new slot. */
5107  if (!rl_kill_ring)
5108  {
5109  /* If we don't have any defined, then make one. */
5110  rl_kill_ring = (char **)
5111  xmalloc (((rl_kill_ring_length = 1) + 1) * sizeof (char *));
5112  slot = 1;
5113  }
5114  else
5115  {
5116  /* We have to add a new slot on the end, unless we have
5117  exceeded the max limit for remembering kills. */
5118  slot = rl_kill_ring_length;
5119  if (slot == rl_max_kills)
5120  {
5121  register int i;
5122  free (rl_kill_ring[0]);
5123  for (i = 0; i < slot; i++)
5124  rl_kill_ring[i] = rl_kill_ring[i + 1];
5125  }
5126  else
5127  {
5128  rl_kill_ring =
5129  (char **)
5130  xrealloc (rl_kill_ring,
5131  ((slot = (rl_kill_ring_length += 1)) + 1)
5132  * sizeof (char *));
5133  }
5134  }
5135  slot--;
5136  }
5137  else
5138  {
5139  slot = rl_kill_ring_length - 1;
5140  }
5141 
5142  /* If the last command was a kill, prepend or append. */
5143  if (last_command_was_kill && rl_editing_mode != vi_mode)
5144  {
5145  char *old = rl_kill_ring[slot];
5146  char *new = (char *)xmalloc (1 + strlen (old) + strlen (text));
5147 
5148  if (from < to)
5149  {
5150  strcpy (new, old);
5151  strcat (new, text);
5152  }
5153  else
5154  {
5155  strcpy (new, text);
5156  strcat (new, old);
5157  }
5158  free (old);
5159  free (text);
5160  rl_kill_ring[slot] = new;
5161  }
5162  else
5163  {
5164  rl_kill_ring[slot] = text;
5165  }
5166  rl_kill_index = slot;
5167  last_command_was_kill++;
5168 }
5169 
5170 /* Now REMEMBER! In order to do prepending or appending correctly, kill
5171  commands always make rl_point's original position be the FROM argument,
5172  and rl_point's extent be the TO argument. */
5173 
5174 /* **************************************************************** */
5175 /* */
5176 /* Killing Commands */
5177 /* */
5178 /* **************************************************************** */
5179 
5180 /* Delete the word at point, saving the text in the kill ring. */
5181 rl_kill_word (count)
5182  int count;
5183 {
5184  int orig_point = rl_point;
5185 
5186  if (count < 0)
5187  rl_backward_kill_word (-count);
5188  else
5189  {
5190  rl_forward_word (count);
5191 
5192  if (rl_point != orig_point)
5193  rl_kill_text (orig_point, rl_point);
5194 
5195  rl_point = orig_point;
5196  }
5197 }
5198 
5199 /* Rubout the word before point, placing it on the kill ring. */
5200 rl_backward_kill_word (count)
5201  int count;
5202 {
5203  int orig_point = rl_point;
5204 
5205  if (count < 0)
5206  rl_kill_word (-count);
5207  else
5208  {
5209  rl_backward_word (count);
5210 
5211  if (rl_point != orig_point)
5212  rl_kill_text (orig_point, rl_point);
5213  }
5214 }
5215 
5216 /* Kill from here to the end of the line. If DIRECTION is negative, kill
5217  back to the line start instead. */
5218 rl_kill_line (direction)
5219  int direction;
5220 {
5221  int orig_point = rl_point;
5222 
5223  if (direction < 0)
5224  rl_backward_kill_line (1);
5225  else
5226  {
5227  rl_end_of_line ();
5228  if (orig_point != rl_point)
5229  rl_kill_text (orig_point, rl_point);
5230  rl_point = orig_point;
5231  }
5232 }
5233 
5234 /* Kill backwards to the start of the line. If DIRECTION is negative, kill
5235  forwards to the line end instead. */
5236 rl_backward_kill_line (direction)
5237  int direction;
5238 {
5239  int orig_point = rl_point;
5240 
5241  if (direction < 0)
5242  rl_kill_line (1);
5243  else
5244  {
5245  if (!rl_point)
5246  ding ();
5247  else
5248  {
5249  rl_beg_of_line ();
5250  rl_kill_text (orig_point, rl_point);
5251  }
5252  }
5253 }
5254 
5255 /* Yank back the last killed text. This ignores arguments. */
5256 rl_yank ()
5257 {
5258  if (!rl_kill_ring) rl_abort ();
5259  rl_insert_text (rl_kill_ring[rl_kill_index]);
5260 }
5261 
5262 /* If the last command was yank, or yank_pop, and the text just
5263  before point is identical to the current kill item, then
5264  delete that text from the line, rotate the index down, and
5265  yank back some other text. */
5266 rl_yank_pop ()
5267 {
5268  int l;
5269 
5270  if (((rl_last_func != rl_yank_pop) && (rl_last_func != rl_yank)) ||
5271  !rl_kill_ring)
5272  {
5273  rl_abort ();
5274  }
5275 
5276  l = strlen (rl_kill_ring[rl_kill_index]);
5277  if (((rl_point - l) >= 0) &&
5278  (strncmp (the_line + (rl_point - l),
5279  rl_kill_ring[rl_kill_index], l) == 0))
5280  {
5281  rl_delete_text ((rl_point - l), rl_point);
5282  rl_point -= l;
5283  rl_kill_index--;
5284  if (rl_kill_index < 0)
5285  rl_kill_index = rl_kill_ring_length - 1;
5286  rl_yank ();
5287  }
5288  else
5289  rl_abort ();
5290 
5291 }
5292 
5293 /* Yank the COUNTth argument from the previous history line. */
5294 rl_yank_nth_arg (count, ignore)
5295  int count;
5296 {
5297  register HIST_ENTRY *entry = previous_history ();
5298  char *arg;
5299 
5300  if (entry)
5301  next_history ();
5302  else
5303  {
5304  ding ();
5305  return;
5306  }
5307 
5308  arg = history_arg_extract (count, count, entry->line);
5309  if (!arg || !*arg)
5310  {
5311  ding ();
5312  return;
5313  }
5314 
5315  rl_begin_undo_group ();
5316 
5317 #if defined (VI_MODE)
5318  /* Vi mode always inserts a space befoe yanking the argument, and it
5319  inserts it right *after* rl_point. */
5320  if (rl_editing_mode == vi_mode)
5321  rl_point++;
5322 #endif /* VI_MODE */
5323 
5324  if (rl_point && the_line[rl_point - 1] != ' ')
5325  rl_insert_text (" ");
5326 
5327  rl_insert_text (arg);
5328  free (arg);
5329 
5330  rl_end_undo_group ();
5331 }

5348 
5349 /* **************************************************************** */
5350 /* */
5351 /* Completion */
5352 /* */
5353 /* **************************************************************** */
5354 
5355 /* Non-zero means that case is not significant in completion. */
5356 int completion_case_fold = 0;
5357 
5358 /* Return an array of (char *) which is a list of completions for TEXT.
5359  If there are no completions, return a NULL pointer.
5360  The first entry in the returned array is the substitution for TEXT.
5361  The remaining entries are the possible completions.
5362  The array is terminated with a NULL pointer.
5363 
5364  ENTRY_FUNCTION is a function of two args, and returns a (char *).
5365  The first argument is TEXT.
5366  The second is a state argument; it should be zero on the first call, and
5367  non-zero on subsequent calls. It returns a NULL pointer to the caller
5368  when there are no more matches.
5369  */
5370 char **
5371 completion_matches (text, entry_function)
5372  char *text;
5373  char *(*entry_function) ();
5374 {
5375  /* Number of slots in match_list. */
5376  int match_list_size;
5377 
5378  /* The list of matches. */
5379  char **match_list =
5380  (char **)xmalloc (((match_list_size = 10) + 1) * sizeof (char *));
5381 
5382  /* Number of matches actually found. */
5383  int matches = 0;
5384 
5385  /* Temporary string binder. */
5386  char *string;
5387 
5388  match_list[1] = (char *)NULL;
5389 
5390  while (string = (*entry_function) (text, matches))
5391  {
5392  if (matches + 1 == match_list_size)
5393  match_list = (char **)xrealloc
5394  (match_list, ((match_list_size += 10) + 1) * sizeof (char *));
5395 
5396  match_list[++matches] = string;
5397  match_list[matches + 1] = (char *)NULL;
5398  }
5399 
5400  /* If there were any matches, then look through them finding out the
5401  lowest common denominator. That then becomes match_list[0]. */
5402  if (matches)
5403  {
5404  register int i = 1;
5405  int low = 100000; /* Count of max-matched characters. */
5406 
5407  /* If only one match, just use that. */
5408  if (matches == 1)
5409  {
5410  match_list[0] = match_list[1];
5411  match_list[1] = (char *)NULL;
5412  }
5413  else
5414  {
5415  /* Otherwise, compare each member of the list with
5416  the next, finding out where they stop matching. */
5417 
5418  while (i < matches)
5419  {
5420  register int c1, c2, si;
5421 
5422  if (completion_case_fold)
5423  {
5424  for (si = 0;
5425  (c1 = to_lower(match_list[i][si])) &&
5426  (c2 = to_lower(match_list[i + 1][si]));
5427  si++)
5428  if (c1 != c2) break;
5429  }
5430  else
5431  {
5432  for (si = 0;
5433  (c1 = match_list[i][si]) &&
5434  (c2 = match_list[i + 1][si]);
5435  si++)
5436  if (c1 != c2) break;
5437  }
5438 
5439  if (low > si) low = si;
5440  i++;
5441  }
5442  match_list[0] = (char *)xmalloc (low + 1);
5443  strncpy (match_list[0], match_list[1], low);
5444  match_list[0][low] = '\0';
5445  }
5446  }
5447  else /* There were no matches. */
5448  {
5449  free (match_list);
5450  match_list = (char **)NULL;
5451  }
5452  return (match_list);
5453 }
5454 
5455 /* Okay, now we write the entry_function for filename completion. In the
5456  general case. Note that completion in the shell is a little different
5457  because of all the pathnames that must be followed when looking up the
5458  completion for a command. */
5459 char *
5460 filename_completion_function (text, state)
5461  int state;
5462  char *text;
5463 {
5464 #if !defined(__MWERKS__) && !defined(_MSC_VER)
5465  static DIR *directory;
5466  static char *filename = (char *)NULL;
5467  static char *dirname = (char *)NULL;
5468  static char *users_dirname = (char *)NULL;
5469  static int filename_len;
5470 
5471  dirent *entry = (dirent *)NULL;
5472 
5473  /* If we don't have any state, then do some initialization. */
5474  if (!state)
5475  {
5476  char *temp;
5477 
5478  if (dirname) free (dirname);
5479  if (filename) free (filename);
5480  if (users_dirname) free (users_dirname);
5481 
5482  filename = savestring (text);
5483  if (!*text) text = ".";
5484  dirname = savestring (text);
5485 
5486  temp = rindex (dirname, '/');
5487 
5488  if (temp)
5489  {
5490  strcpy (filename, ++temp);
5491  *temp = '\0';
5492  }
5493  else
5494  strcpy (dirname, ".");
5495 
5496  /* We aren't done yet. We also support the "~user" syntax. */
5497 
5498  /* Save the version of the directory that the user typed. */
5499  users_dirname = savestring (dirname);
5500  {
5501  char *temp_dirname;
5502 
5503  temp_dirname = tilde_expand (dirname);
5504  free (dirname);
5505  dirname = temp_dirname;
5506 
5507  if (rl_symbolic_link_hook)
5508  (*rl_symbolic_link_hook) (&dirname);
5509  }
5510  directory = opendir (dirname);
5511  filename_len = strlen (filename);
5512 
5513  rl_filename_completion_desired = 1;
5514  }
5515 
5516  /* At this point we should entertain the possibility of hacking wildcarded
5517  filenames, like /usr/man/man<WILD>/te<TAB>. If the directory name
5518  contains globbing characters, then build an array of directories to
5519  glob on, and glob on the first one. */
5520 
5521  /* Now that we have some state, we can read the directory. */
5522 
5523  while (directory && (entry = readdir (directory)))
5524  {
5525  /* Special case for no filename.
5526  All entries except "." and ".." match. */
5527  if (!filename_len)
5528  {
5529  if ((strcmp (entry->d_name, ".") != 0) &&
5530  (strcmp (entry->d_name, "..") != 0))
5531  break;
5532  }
5533  else
5534  {
5535  /* Otherwise, if these match upto the length of filename, then
5536  it is a match. */
5537  if (entry->d_name[0] == filename[0] && /* Quick test */
5538  (strncmp (filename, entry->d_name, filename_len) == 0))
5539  {
5540  break;
5541  }
5542  }
5543  }
5544 
5545  if (!entry)
5546  {
5547  if (directory)
5548  {
5549  closedir (directory);
5550  directory = (DIR *)NULL;
5551  }
5552  return (char *)NULL;
5553  }
5554  else
5555  {
5556  char *temp;
5557 
5558  if (dirname && (strcmp (dirname, ".") != 0))
5559  {
5560  temp = (char *)
5561  xmalloc (1 + strlen (users_dirname) + strlen (entry->d_name));
5562  strcpy (temp, users_dirname);
5563  strcat (temp, entry->d_name);
5564  }
5565  else
5566  {
5567  temp = (savestring (entry->d_name));
5568  }
5569  return (temp);
5570  }
5571 #endif
5572  return 0;
5573 }
5574 
5575 
5576 /* **************************************************************** */
5577 /* */
5578 /* Binding keys */
5579 /* */
5580 /* **************************************************************** */
5581 
5582 /* rl_add_defun (char *name, Function *function, int key)
5583  Add NAME to the list of named functions. Make FUNCTION
5584  be the function that gets called.
5585  If KEY is not -1, then bind it. */
5586 rl_add_defun (name, function, key)
5587  char *name;
5588  Function *function;
5589  int key;
5590 {
5591  if (key != -1)
5592  rl_bind_key (key, function);
5593  rl_add_funmap_entry (name, function);
5594 }
5595 
5596 /* Bind KEY to FUNCTION. Returns non-zero if KEY is out of range. */
5597 int
5598 rl_bind_key (key, function)
5599  int key;
5600  Function *function;
5601 {
5602  if (key < 0)
5603  return (key);
5604 
5605  if (key > 127 && key < 256)
5606  {
5607  if (keymap[ESC].type == ISKMAP)
5608  {
5609  Keymap escmap = (Keymap)keymap[ESC].function;
5610 
5611  key -= 128;
5612  escmap[key].type = ISFUNC;
5613  escmap[key].function = function;
5614  return (0);
5615  }
5616  return (key);
5617  }
5618 
5619  keymap[key].type = ISFUNC;
5620  keymap[key].function = function;
5621  return (0);
5622 }
5623 
5624 /* Bind KEY to FUNCTION in MAP. Returns non-zero in case of invalid
5625  KEY. */
5626 int
5627 rl_bind_key_in_map (key, function, map)
5628  int key;
5629  Function *function;
5630  Keymap map;
5631 {
5632  int result;
5633  Keymap oldmap = keymap;
5634 
5635  keymap = map;
5636  result = rl_bind_key (key, function);
5637  keymap = oldmap;
5638  return (result);
5639 }
5640 
5641 /* Make KEY do nothing in the currently selected keymap.
5642  Returns non-zero in case of error. */
5643 int
5644 rl_unbind_key (key)
5645  int key;
5646 {
5647  return (rl_bind_key (key, (Function *)NULL));

5649 
5650 /* Make KEY do nothing in MAP.
5651  Returns non-zero in case of error. */
5652 int
5653 rl_unbind_key_in_map (key, map)
5654  int key;
5655  Keymap map;
5656 {
5657  return (rl_bind_key_in_map (key, (Function *)NULL, map));
5658 }
5659 
5660 /* Bind the key sequence represented by the string KEYSEQ to
5661  FUNCTION. This makes new keymaps as necessary. The initial
5662  place to do bindings is in MAP. */
5663 rl_set_key (keyseq, function, map)
5664  char *keyseq;
5665  Function *function;
5666  Keymap map;
5667 {
5668  rl_generic_bind (ISFUNC, keyseq, function, map);
5669 }
5670 
5671 /* Bind the key sequence represented by the string KEYSEQ to
5672  the string of characters MACRO. This makes new keymaps as
5673  necessary. The initial place to do bindings is in MAP. */
5674 rl_macro_bind (keyseq, macro, map)
5675  char *keyseq, *macro;
5676  Keymap map;
5677 {
5678  char *macro_keys;
5679  int macro_keys_len;
5680 
5681  macro_keys = (char *)xmalloc ((2 * strlen (macro)) + 1);
5682 
5683  if (rl_translate_keyseq (macro, macro_keys, &macro_keys_len))
5684  {
5685  free (macro_keys);
5686  return;
5687  }
5688  rl_generic_bind (ISMACR, keyseq, macro_keys, map);
5689 }
5690 
5691 /* Bind the key sequence represented by the string KEYSEQ to
5692  the arbitrary pointer DATA. TYPE says what kind of data is
5693  pointed to by DATA, right now this can be a function (ISFUNC),
5694  a macro (ISMACR), or a keymap (ISKMAP). This makes new keymaps
5695  as necessary. The initial place to do bindings is in MAP. */
5696 
5697 static void
5698 rl_generic_bind (type, keyseq, data, map)
5699  int type;
5700  char *keyseq, *data;
5701  Keymap map;
5702 {
5703  char *keys;
5704  int keys_len;
5705  register int i;
5706 
5707  /* If no keys to bind to, exit right away. */
5708  if (!keyseq || !*keyseq)
5709  {
5710  if (type == ISMACR)
5711  free (data);
5712  return;
5713  }
5714 
5715  keys = (char *)alloca (1 + (2 * strlen (keyseq)));
5716 
5717  /* Translate the ASCII representation of KEYSEQ into an array
5718  of characters. Stuff the characters into ARRAY, and the
5719  length of ARRAY into LENGTH. */
5720  if (rl_translate_keyseq (keyseq, keys, &keys_len))
5721  return;
5722 
5723  /* Bind keys, making new keymaps as necessary. */
5724  for (i = 0; i < keys_len; i++)
5725  {
5726  if (i + 1 < keys_len)
5727  {
5728  if (map[keys[i]].type != ISKMAP)
5729  {
5730  if (map[i].type == ISMACR)
5731  free ((char *)map[i].function);
5732 
5733  map[keys[i]].type = ISKMAP;
5734  map[keys[i]].function = (Function *)rl_make_bare_keymap ();
5735  }
5736  map = (Keymap)map[keys[i]].function;
5737  }
5738  else
5739  {
5740  if (map[keys[i]].type == ISMACR)
5741  free ((char *)map[keys[i]].function);
5742 
5743  map[keys[i]].function = (Function *)data;
5744  map[keys[i]].type = type;
5745  }
5746  }
5747 }
5748 
5749 /* Translate the ASCII representation of SEQ, stuffing the
5750  values into ARRAY, an array of characters. LEN gets the
5751  final length of ARRAY. Return non-zero if there was an
5752  error parsing SEQ. */
5753 rl_translate_keyseq (seq, array, len)
5754  char *seq, *array;
5755  int *len;
5756 {
5757  register int i, c, l = 0;
5758 
5759  for (i = 0; c = seq[i]; i++)
5760  {
5761  if (c == '\\')
5762  {
5763  c = seq[++i];
5764 
5765  if (!c)
5766  break;
5767 
5768  if (((c == 'C' || c == 'M') && seq[i + 1] == '-') ||
5769  (c == 'e'))
5770  {
5771  /* Handle special case of backwards define. */
5772  if (strncmp (&seq[i], "C-\\M-", 5) == 0)
5773  {
5774  array[l++] = ESC;
5775  i += 5;
5776  array[l++] = CTRL (to_upper (seq[i]));
5777  if (!seq[i])
5778  i--;
5779  continue;
5780  }
5781 
5782  switch (c)
5783  {
5784  case 'M':
5785  i++;
5786  array[l++] = ESC;
5787  break;
5788 
5789  case 'C':
5790  i += 2;
5791  /* Special hack for C-?... */
5792  if (seq[i] == '?')
5793  array[l++] = RUBOUT;
5794  else
5795  array[l++] = CTRL (to_upper (seq[i]));
5796  break;
5797 
5798  case 'e':
5799  array[l++] = ESC;
5800  }
5801 
5802  continue;
5803  }
5804  }
5805  array[l++] = c;
5806  }
5807 
5808  *len = l;
5809  array[l] = '\0';
5810  return (0);
5811 }
5812 
5813 /* Return a pointer to the function that STRING represents.
5814  If STRING doesn't have a matching function, then a NULL pointer
5815  is returned. */
5816 Function *
5817 rl_named_function (string)
5818  char *string;
5819 {
5820  register int i;
5821 
5822  for (i = 0; funmap[i]; i++)
5823  if (stricmp (funmap[i]->name, string) == 0)
5824  return (funmap[i]->function);
5825  return ((Function *)NULL);
5826 }
5827 
5828 /* The last key bindings file read. */
5829 #ifdef __MSDOS__
5830 /* Don't know what to do, but this is a guess */
5831 static char *last_readline_init_file = "/INPUTRC";
5832 #else
5833 static char *last_readline_init_file = "~/.inputrc";
5834 #endif
5835 
5836 /* Re-read the current keybindings file. */
5837 rl_re_read_init_file (count, ignore)
5838  int count, ignore;
5839 {
5840  rl_read_init_file ((char *)NULL);
5841 }
5842 
5843 /* Do key bindings from a file. If FILENAME is NULL it defaults
5844  to `~/.inputrc'. If the file existed and could be opened and
5845  read, 0 is returned, otherwise errno is returned. */
5846 int
5847 rl_read_init_file (filename)
5848  char *filename;
5849 {
5850  register int i;
5851  char *buffer, *openname, *line, *end;
5852  struct stat finfo;
5853  int file;
5854 
5855  /* Default the filename. */
5856  if (!filename)
5857  filename = last_readline_init_file;
5858 
5859  openname = tilde_expand (filename);
5860 
5861  if (!openname || *openname == '\000')
5862  return ENOENT;
5863 
5864  if ((stat (openname, &finfo) < 0) ||
5865  (file = open (openname, O_RDONLY, 0666)) < 0)
5866  {
5867  free (openname);
5868  return (errno);
5869  }
5870  else
5871  free (openname);
5872 
5873  last_readline_init_file = filename;
5874 
5875  /* Read the file into BUFFER. */
5876  buffer = (char *)xmalloc (finfo.st_size + 1);
5877  i = read (file, buffer, finfo.st_size);
5878  close (file);
5879 
5880  if (i != finfo.st_size)
5881  return (errno);
5882 
5883  /* Loop over the lines in the file. Lines that start with `#' are
5884  comments; all other lines are commands for readline initialization. */
5885  line = buffer;
5886  end = buffer + finfo.st_size;
5887  while (line < end)
5888  {
5889  /* Find the end of this line. */
5890  for (i = 0; line + i != end && line[i] != '\n'; i++);
5891 
5892  /* Mark end of line. */
5893  line[i] = '\0';
5894 
5895  /* If the line is not a comment, then parse it. */
5896  if (*line != '#')
5897  rl_parse_and_bind (line);
5898 
5899  /* Move to the next line. */
5900  line += i + 1;
5901  }
5902  return (0);
5903 }
5904 
5905 /* **************************************************************** */
5906 /* */
5907 /* Parser Directives */
5908 /* */
5909 /* **************************************************************** */
5910 
5911 /* Conditionals. */
5912 
5913 /* Calling programs set this to have their argv[0]. */
5914 char *rl_readline_name = "other";
5915 
5916 /* Stack of previous values of parsing_conditionalized_out. */
5917 static unsigned char *if_stack = (unsigned char *)NULL;
5918 static int if_stack_depth = 0;
5919 static int if_stack_size = 0;
5920 
5921 /* Push parsing_conditionalized_out, and set parser state based on ARGS. */
5922 parser_if (args)
5923  char *args;
5924 {
5925  register int i;
5926 
5927  /* Push parser state. */
5928  if (if_stack_depth + 1 >= if_stack_size)
5929  {
5930  if (!if_stack)
5931  if_stack = (unsigned char *)xmalloc (if_stack_size = 20);
5932  else
5933  if_stack = (unsigned char *)xrealloc (if_stack, if_stack_size += 20);
5934  }
5935  if_stack[if_stack_depth++] = parsing_conditionalized_out;
5936 
5937  /* If parsing is turned off, then nothing can turn it back on except
5938  for finding the matching endif. In that case, return right now. */
5939  if (parsing_conditionalized_out)
5940  return;
5941 
5942  /* Isolate first argument. */
5943  for (i = 0; args[i] && !whitespace (args[i]); i++);
5944 
5945  if (args[i])
5946  args[i++] = '\0';
5947 
5948  /* Handle "if term=foo" and "if mode=emacs" constructs. If this
5949  isn't term=foo, or mode=emacs, then check to see if the first
5950  word in ARGS is the same as the value stored in rl_readline_name. */
5951  if (rl_terminal_name && strnicmp (args, "term=", 5) == 0)
5952  {
5953  char *tem, *tname;
5954 
5955  /* Terminals like "aaa-60" are equivalent to "aaa". */
5956  tname = savestring (rl_terminal_name);
5957  tem = rindex (tname, '-');
5958  if (tem)
5959  *tem = '\0';
5960 
5961  if (stricmp (args + 5, tname) == 0)
5962  parsing_conditionalized_out = 0;
5963  else
5964  parsing_conditionalized_out = 1;
5965 
5966  free (tname);
5967  }
5968 #if defined (VI_MODE)
5969  else if (strnicmp (args, "mode=", 5) == 0)
5970  {
5971  int mode;
5972 
5973  if (stricmp (args + 5, "emacs") == 0)
5974  mode = emacs_mode;
5975  else if (stricmp (args + 5, "vi") == 0)
5976  mode = vi_mode;
5977  else
5978  mode = no_mode;
5979 
5980  if (mode == rl_editing_mode)
5981  parsing_conditionalized_out = 0;
5982  else
5983  parsing_conditionalized_out = 1;
5984  }
5985 #endif /* VI_MODE */
5986  /* Check to see if the first word in ARGS is the same as the
5987  value stored in rl_readline_name. */
5988  else if (stricmp (args, rl_readline_name) == 0)
5989  parsing_conditionalized_out = 0;
5990  else
5991  parsing_conditionalized_out = 1;
5992 }
5993 
5994 /* Invert the current parser state if there is anything on the stack. */
5995 parser_else (args)
5996  char *args;
5997 {
5998  register int i;
5999 
6000  if (!if_stack_depth)
6001  {
6002  /* Error message? */
6003  return;
6004  }
6005 
6006  /* Check the previous (n - 1) levels of the stack to make sure that
6007  we haven't previously turned off parsing. */
6008  for (i = 0; i < if_stack_depth - 1; i++)
6009  if (if_stack[i] == 1)
6010  return;
6011 
6012  /* Invert the state of parsing if at top level. */
6013  parsing_conditionalized_out = !parsing_conditionalized_out;
6014 }
6015 
6016 /* Terminate a conditional, popping the value of
6017  parsing_conditionalized_out from the stack. */
6018 parser_endif (args)
6019  char *args;
6020 {
6021  if (if_stack_depth)
6022  parsing_conditionalized_out = if_stack[--if_stack_depth];
6023  else
6024  {
6025  /* *** What, no error message? *** */
6026  }
6027 }
6028 
6029 /* Associate textual names with actual functions. */
6030 static struct {
6031  char *name;
6032  Function *function;
6033 } parser_directives [] = {
6034  { "if", parser_if },
6035  { "endif", parser_endif },
6036  { "else", parser_else },
6037  { (char *)0x0, (Function *)0x0 }
6038 };
6039 
6040 /* Handle a parser directive. STATEMENT is the line of the directive
6041  without any leading `$'. */
6042 static int
6043 handle_parser_directive (statement)
6044  char *statement;
6045 {
6046  register int i;
6047  char *directive, *args;
6048 
6049  /* Isolate the actual directive. */
6050 
6051  /* Skip whitespace. */
6052  for (i = 0; whitespace (statement[i]); i++);
6053 
6054  directive = &statement[i];
6055 
6056  for (; statement[i] && !whitespace (statement[i]); i++);
6057 
6058  if (statement[i])
6059  statement[i++] = '\0';
6060 
6061  for (; statement[i] && whitespace (statement[i]); i++);
6062 
6063  args = &statement[i];
6064 
6065  /* Lookup the command, and act on it. */
6066  for (i = 0; parser_directives[i].name; i++)
6067  if (stricmp (directive, parser_directives[i].name) == 0)
6068  {
6069  (*parser_directives[i].function) (args);
6070  return (0);
6071  }
6072 
6073  /* *** Should an error message be output? */
6074  return (1);
6075 }
6076 
6077 /* Ugly but working hack for binding prefix meta. */
6078 #define PREFIX_META_HACK
6079 
6080 static int substring_member_of_array ();
6081 
6082 /* Read the binding command from STRING and perform it.
6083  A key binding command looks like: Keyname: function-name\0,
6084  a variable binding command looks like: set variable value.
6085  A new-style keybinding looks like "\C-x\C-x": exchange-point-and-mark. */
6086 rl_parse_and_bind (string)
6087  char *string;
6088 {
6089  extern char *possible_control_prefixes[], *possible_meta_prefixes[];
6090  char *funname, *kname;
6091  register int c;
6092  int key, i;
6093 
6094  while (string && whitespace (*string))
6095  string++;
6096 
6097  if (!string || !*string || *string == '#')
6098  return;
6099 
6100  /* If this is a parser directive, act on it. */
6101  if (*string == '$')
6102  {
6103  handle_parser_directive (&string[1]);
6104  return;
6105  }
6106 
6107  /* If we are supposed to be skipping parsing right now, then do it. */
6108  if (parsing_conditionalized_out)
6109  return;
6110 
6111  i = 0;
6112  /* If this keyname is a complex key expression surrounded by quotes,
6113  advance to after the matching close quote. */
6114  if (*string == '"')
6115  {
6116  for (i = 1; c = string[i]; i++)
6117  {
6118  if (c == '"' && string[i - 1] != '\\')
6119  break;
6120  }
6121  }
6122 
6123  /* Advance to the colon (:) or whitespace which separates the two objects. */
6124  for (; (c = string[i]) && c != ':' && c != ' ' && c != '\t'; i++ );
6125 
6126  /* Mark the end of the command (or keyname). */
6127  if (string[i])
6128  string[i++] = '\0';
6129 
6130  /* If this is a command to set a variable, then do that. */
6131  if (stricmp (string, "set") == 0)
6132  {
6133  char *var = string + i;
6134  char *value;
6135 
6136  /* Make VAR point to start of variable name. */
6137  while (*var && whitespace (*var)) var++;
6138 
6139  /* Make value point to start of value string. */
6140  value = var;
6141  while (*value && !whitespace (*value)) value++;
6142  if (*value)
6143  *value++ = '\0';
6144  while (*value && whitespace (*value)) value++;
6145 
6146  rl_variable_bind (var, value);
6147  return;
6148  }
6149 
6150  /* Skip any whitespace between keyname and funname. */
6151  for (; string[i] && whitespace (string[i]); i++);
6152  funname = &string[i];
6153 
6154  /* Now isolate funname.
6155  For straight function names just look for whitespace, since
6156  that will signify the end of the string. But this could be a
6157  macro definition. In that case, the string is quoted, so skip
6158  to the matching delimiter. */
6159  if (*funname == '\'' || *funname == '"')
6160  {
6161  int delimiter = string[i++];
6162 
6163  for (; c = string[i]; i++)
6164  {
6165  if (c == delimiter && string[i - 1] != '\\')
6166  break;
6167  }
6168  if (c)
6169  i++;
6170  }
6171 
6172  /* Advance to the end of the string. */
6173  for (; string[i] && !whitespace (string[i]); i++);
6174 
6175  /* No extra whitespace at the end of the string. */
6176  string[i] = '\0';
6177 
6178  /* If this is a new-style key-binding, then do the binding with
6179  rl_set_key (). Otherwise, let the older code deal with it. */
6180  if (*string == '"')
6181  {
6182  char *seq = (char *)alloca (1 + strlen (string));
6183  register int j, k = 0;
6184 
6185  for (j = 1; string[j]; j++)
6186  {
6187  if (string[j] == '"' && string[j - 1] != '\\')
6188  break;
6189 
6190  seq[k++] = string[j];
6191  }
6192  seq[k] = '\0';
6193 
6194  /* Binding macro? */
6195  if (*funname == '\'' || *funname == '"')
6196  {
6197  j = strlen (funname);
6198 
6199  if (j && funname[j - 1] == *funname)
6200  funname[j - 1] = '\0';
6201 
6202  rl_macro_bind (seq, &funname[1], keymap);
6203  }
6204  else
6205  rl_set_key (seq, rl_named_function (funname), keymap);
6206 
6207  return;
6208  }
6209 
6210  /* Get the actual character we want to deal with. */
6211  kname = rindex (string, '-');
6212  if (!kname)
6213  kname = string;
6214  else
6215  kname++;
6216 
6217  key = glean_key_from_name (kname);
6218 
6219  /* Add in control and meta bits. */
6220  if (substring_member_of_array (string, possible_control_prefixes))
6221  key = CTRL (to_upper (key));
6222 
6223  if (substring_member_of_array (string, possible_meta_prefixes))
6224  key = META (key);
6225 
6226  /* Temporary. Handle old-style keyname with macro-binding. */
6227  if (*funname == '\'' || *funname == '"')
6228  {
6229  char seq[2];
6230  int fl = strlen (funname);
6231 
6232  seq[0] = key; seq[1] = '\0';
6233  if (fl && funname[fl - 1] == *funname)
6234  funname[fl - 1] = '\0';
6235 
6236  rl_macro_bind (seq, &funname[1], keymap);
6237  }
6238 #if defined (PREFIX_META_HACK)
6239  /* Ugly, but working hack to keep prefix-meta around. */
6240  else if (stricmp (funname, "prefix-meta") == 0)
6241  {
6242  char seq[2];
6243 
6244  seq[0] = key;
6245  seq[1] = '\0';
6246  rl_generic_bind (ISKMAP, seq, (char *)emacs_meta_keymap, keymap);
6247  }
6248 #endif /* PREFIX_META_HACK */
6249  else
6250  rl_bind_key (key, rl_named_function (funname));
6251 }
6252 
6253 rl_variable_bind (name, value)
6254  char *name, *value;
6255 {
6256  if (stricmp (name, "editing-mode") == 0)
6257  {
6258  if (strnicmp (value, "vi", 2) == 0)
6259  {
6260 #if defined (VI_MODE)
6261  keymap = vi_insertion_keymap;
6262  rl_editing_mode = vi_mode;
6263 #else
6264 #if defined (NOTDEF)
6265  /* What state is the terminal in? I'll tell you:
6266  non-determinate! That means we cannot do any output. */
6267  ding ();
6268 #endif /* NOTDEF */
6269 #endif /* VI_MODE */
6270  }
6271  else if (strnicmp (value, "emacs", 5) == 0)
6272  {
6273  keymap = emacs_standard_keymap;
6274  rl_editing_mode = emacs_mode;
6275  }
6276  }
6277  else if (stricmp (name, "horizontal-scroll-mode") == 0)
6278  {
6279  if (!*value || stricmp (value, "On") == 0)
6280  horizontal_scroll_mode = 1;
6281  else
6282  horizontal_scroll_mode = 0;
6283  }
6284  else if (stricmp (name, "mark-modified-lines") == 0)
6285  {
6286  if (!*value || stricmp (value, "On") == 0)
6287  mark_modified_lines = 1;
6288  else
6289  mark_modified_lines = 0;
6290  }
6291  else if (stricmp (name, "prefer-visible-bell") == 0)
6292  {
6293  if (!*value || stricmp (value, "On") == 0)
6294  prefer_visible_bell = 1;
6295  else
6296  prefer_visible_bell = 0;
6297  }
6298  else if (stricmp (name, "comment-begin") == 0)
6299  {
6300 #if defined (VI_MODE)
6301  extern char *rl_vi_comment_begin;
6302 
6303  if (*value)
6304  {
6305  if (rl_vi_comment_begin)
6306  free (rl_vi_comment_begin);
6307 
6308  rl_vi_comment_begin = savestring (value);
6309  }
6310 #endif /* VI_MODE */
6311  }
6312 }
6313 
6314 /* Return the character which matches NAME.
6315  For example, `Space' returns ' '. */
6316 
6317 typedef struct {
6318  char *name;
6319  int value;
6320 } assoc_list;
6321 
6322 assoc_list name_key_alist[] = {
6323  { "DEL", 0x7f },
6324  { "ESC", '\033' },
6325  { "Escape", '\033' },
6326  { "LFD", '\n' },
6327  { "Newline", '\n' },
6328  { "RET", '\r' },
6329  { "Return", '\r' },
6330  { "Rubout", 0x7f },
6331  { "SPC", ' ' },
6332  { "Space", ' ' },
6333  { "Tab", 0x09 },
6334  { (char *)0x0, 0 }
6335 };
6336 
6337 int
6338 glean_key_from_name (name)
6339  char *name;
6340 {
6341  register int i;
6342 
6343  for (i = 0; name_key_alist[i].name; i++)
6344  if (stricmp (name, name_key_alist[i].name) == 0)
6345  return (name_key_alist[i].value);
6346 
6347  return (*name);
6348 }
