6351 /* **************************************************************** */
6352 /* */
6353 /* Key Binding and Function Information */
6354 /* */
6355 /* **************************************************************** */
6356 
6357 /* Each of the following functions produces information about the
6358  state of keybindings and functions known to Readline. The info
6359  is always printed to rl_outstream, and in such a way that it can
6360  be read back in (i.e., passed to rl_parse_and_bind (). */
6361 
6362 /* Print the names of functions known to Readline. */
6363 void
6364 rl_list_funmap_names (ignore)
6365  int ignore;
6366 {
6367  register int i;
6368  char **funmap_names;
6369  extern char **rl_funmap_names ();
6370 
6371  funmap_names = rl_funmap_names ();
6372 
6373  if (!funmap_names)
6374  return;
6375 
6376  for (i = 0; funmap_names[i]; i++)
6377  fprintf (rl_outstream, "%s\n", funmap_names[i]);
6378 
6379  free (funmap_names);
6380 }
6381 
6382 /* Return a NULL terminated array of strings which represent the key
6383  sequences that are used to invoke FUNCTION in MAP. */
6384 static char **
6385 invoking_keyseqs_in_map (function, map)
6386  Function *function;
6387  Keymap map;
6388 {
6389  register int key;
6390  char **result;
6391  int result_index, result_size;
6392 
6393  result = (char **)NULL;
6394  result_index = result_size = 0;
6395 
6396  for (key = 0; key < 128; key++)
6397  {
6398  switch (map[key].type)
6399  {
6400  case ISMACR:
6401  /* Macros match, if, and only if, the pointers are identical.
6402  Thus, they are treated exactly like functions in here. */
6403  case ISFUNC:
6404  /* If the function in the keymap is the one we are looking for,
6405  then add the current KEY to the list of invoking keys. */
6406  if (map[key].function == function)
6407  {
6408  char *keyname = (char *)xmalloc (5);
6409 
6410  if (CTRL_P (key))
6411  sprintf (keyname, "\\C-%c", to_lower (UNCTRL (key)));
6412  else if (key == RUBOUT)
6413  sprintf (keyname, "\\C-?");
6414  else
6415  sprintf (keyname, "%c", key);
6416 
6417  if (result_index + 2 > result_size)
6418  {
6419  if (!result)
6420  result = (char **) xmalloc
6421  ((result_size = 10) * sizeof (char *));
6422  else
6423  result = (char **) xrealloc
6424  (result, (result_size += 10) * sizeof (char *));
6425  }
6426 
6427  result[result_index++] = keyname;
6428  result[result_index] = (char *)NULL;
6429  }
6430  break;
6431 
6432  case ISKMAP:
6433  {
6434  char **seqs = (char **)NULL;
6435 
6436  /* Find the list of keyseqs in this map which have FUNCTION as
6437  their target. Add the key sequences found to RESULT. */
6438  if (map[key].function)
6439  seqs =
6440  invoking_keyseqs_in_map (function, (Keymap)map[key].function);
6441 
6442  if (seqs)
6443  {
6444  register int i;
6445 
6446  for (i = 0; seqs[i]; i++)
6447  {
6448  char *keyname = (char *)xmalloc (6 + strlen (seqs[i]));
6449 
6450  if (key == ESC)
6451  sprintf (keyname, "\\e");
6452  else if (CTRL_P (key))
6453  sprintf (keyname, "\\C-%c", to_lower (UNCTRL (key)));
6454  else if (key == RUBOUT)
6455  sprintf (keyname, "\\C-?");
6456  else
6457  sprintf (keyname, "%c", key);
6458 
6459  strcat (keyname, seqs[i]);
6460 
6461  if (result_index + 2 > result_size)
6462  {
6463  if (!result)
6464  result = (char **)
6465  xmalloc ((result_size = 10) * sizeof (char *));
6466  else
6467  result = (char **)
6468  xrealloc (result,
6469  (result_size += 10) * sizeof (char *));
6470  }
6471 
6472  result[result_index++] = keyname;
6473  result[result_index] = (char *)NULL;
6474  }
6475  }
6476  }
6477  break;
6478  }
6479  }
6480  return (result);
6481 }
6482 
6483 /* Return a NULL terminated array of strings which represent the key
6484  sequences that can be used to invoke FUNCTION using the current keymap. */
6485 char **
6486 rl_invoking_keyseqs (function)
6487  Function *function;
6488 {
6489  return (invoking_keyseqs_in_map (function, keymap));
6490 }
6491 
6492 /* Print all of the current functions and their bindings to
6493  rl_outstream. If an explicit argument is given, then print
6494  the output in such a way that it can be read back in. */
6495 int
6496 rl_dump_functions (count)
6497  int count;
6498 {
6499  void rl_function_dumper ();
6500 
6501  rl_function_dumper (rl_explicit_arg);
6502  rl_on_new_line ();
6503  return (0);
6504 }
6505 
6506 /* Print all of the functions and their bindings to rl_outstream. If
6507  PRINT_READABLY is non-zero, then print the output in such a way
6508  that it can be read back in. */
6509 void
6510 rl_function_dumper (print_readably)
6511  int print_readably;
6512 {
6513  register int i;
6514  char **rl_funmap_names (), **names;
6515  char *name;
6516 
6517  names = rl_funmap_names ();
6518 
6519  fprintf (rl_outstream, "\n");
6520 
6521  for (i = 0; name = names[i]; i++)
6522  {
6523  Function *function;
6524  char **invokers;
6525 
6526  function = rl_named_function (name);
6527  invokers = invoking_keyseqs_in_map (function, keymap);
6528 
6529  if (print_readably)
6530  {
6531  if (!invokers)
6532  fprintf (rl_outstream, "# %s (not bound)\n", name);
6533  else
6534  {
6535  register int j;
6536 
6537  for (j = 0; invokers[j]; j++)
6538  {
6539  fprintf (rl_outstream, "\"%s\": %s\n",
6540  invokers[j], name);
6541  free (invokers[j]);
6542  }
6543 
6544  free (invokers);
6545  }
6546  }
6547  else
6548  {
6549  if (!invokers)
6550  fprintf (rl_outstream, "%s is not bound to any keys\n",
6551  name);
6552  else
6553  {
6554  register int j;
6555 
6556  fprintf (rl_outstream, "%s can be found on ", name);
6557 
6558  for (j = 0; invokers[j] && j < 5; j++)
6559  {
6560  fprintf (rl_outstream, "\"%s\"%s", invokers[j],
6561  invokers[j + 1] ? ", " : ".\n");
6562  }
6563 
6564  if (j == 5 && invokers[j])
6565  fprintf (rl_outstream, "...\n");
6566 
6567  for (j = 0; invokers[j]; j++)
6568  free (invokers[j]);
6569 
6570  free (invokers);
6571  }
6572  }
6573  }
6574 }
6575 
6576 
6577 /* **************************************************************** */
6578 /* */
6579 /* String Utility Functions */
6580 /* */
6581 /* **************************************************************** */
6582  static char* strindex();
6583 /* Return non-zero if any members of ARRAY are a substring in STRING. */
6584 static int
6585 substring_member_of_array (string, array)
6586  char *string, **array;
6587 {
6588  while (*array)
6589  {
6590  if (strindex (string, *array))
6591  return (1);
6592  array++;
6593  }
6594  return (0);
6595 }
6596 
6597 /* Whoops, Unix doesn't have strnicmp. */
6598 
6599 /* Determine if s2 occurs in s1. If so, return a pointer to the
6600  match in s1. The compare is case insensitive. */
6601 static char *
6602 strindex (s1, s2)
6603  register char *s1, *s2;
6604 {
6605  register int i, l = strlen (s2);
6606  register int len = strlen (s1);
6607 
6608  for (i = 0; (len - i) >= l; i++)
6609  if (strnicmp (&s1[i], s2, l) == 0)
6610  return (s1 + i);
6611  return ((char *)NULL);
6612 }
6613 
6614 /* **************************************************************** */
6615 /* */
6616 /* USG (System V) Support */
6617 /* */
6618 /* **************************************************************** */
6619 
6620 /* When compiling and running in the `Posix' environment, Ultrix does
6621  not restart system calls, so this needs to do it. */
6622 int
6623 rl_getc (stream)
6624  FILE *stream;
6625 {
6626 #ifdef WIN32
6627  return winio_getc();
6628 #else
6629  int result;
6630  unsigned char c;
6631 
6632 #if defined(__GO32__)
6633  if (isatty(0))
6634  return (getkey() & 0x7f);
6635 #endif /* __GO32__ */
6636 
6637  while (1)
6638  {
6639  result = read (fileno (stream), &c, sizeof (char));
6640 
6641  if (result == sizeof (char))
6642  return (c);
6643 
6644  /* If zero characters are returned, then the file that we are
6645  reading from is empty! Return EOF in that case. */
6646  if (result == 0)
6647  return (EOF);
6648 
6649 #ifndef __GO32__
6650  /* If the error that we received was SIGINT, then try again,
6651  this is simply an interrupted system call to read ().
6652  Otherwise, some error ocurred, also signifying EOF. */
6653  if (errno != EINTR)
6654  return (EOF);
6655 #endif /* !__GO32__ */
6656  }
6657 #endif
6658 }
6659 
6660 #if defined (STATIC_MALLOC)
6661 
6662 /* **************************************************************** */
6663 /* */
6664 /* xmalloc and xrealloc () */
6665 /* */
6666 /* **************************************************************** */
6667 
6668 static void memory_error_and_abort ();
6669 
6670 static char *
6671 xmalloc (bytes)
6672  int bytes;
6673 {
6674  char *temp = (char *)malloc (bytes);
6675 
6676  if (!temp)
6677  memory_error_and_abort ();
6678  return (temp);
6679 }
6680 
6681 static char *
6682 xrealloc (pointer, bytes)
6683  char *pointer;
6684  int bytes;
6685 {
6686  char *temp;
6687 
6688  if (!pointer)
6689  temp = (char *)malloc (bytes);
6690  else
6691  temp = (char *)realloc (pointer, bytes);
6692 
6693  if (!temp)
6694  memory_error_and_abort ();
6695 
6696  return (temp);
6697 }
6698 
6699 static void
6700 memory_error_and_abort ()
6701 {
6702  fprintf (stderr, "readline: Out of virtual memory!\n");
6703  abort ();
6704 }
6705 #endif /* STATIC_MALLOC */

6757  }

6764  * Local variables:

6766  * end:
6767  */
6768  #if defined(__MWERKS__)
6769 /* strcmp (), but caseless. */
6770 static int
6771 stricmp (string1, string2)
6772  char *string1, *string2;
6773 {
6774  register char ch1, ch2;
6775 
6776  while (*string1 && *string2)
6777  {
6778  ch1 = *string1++;
6779  ch2 = *string2++;
6780  if (to_upper(ch1) != to_upper(ch2))
6781  return (1);
6782  }
6783  return (*string1 | *string2);
6784 }
6785 /* Compare at most COUNT characters from string1 to string2. Case
6786  doesn't matter. */
6787 static int
6788 strnicmp (string1, string2, count)
6789  char *string1, *string2;
6790 {
6791  register char ch1, ch2;
6792 
6793  while (count)
6794  {
6795  ch1 = *string1++;
6796  ch2 = *string2++;
6797  if (to_upper(ch1) == to_upper(ch2))
6798  count--;
6799  else break;
6800  }
6801  return (count);
6802 }
